Job Type
Permanent
Category
IT
Location
Cork, Ireland
Office Location
Job Details
Role: C# Developer
Job Type: Permanent
Location: Cork, Ireland (Working from office as per business needs)

Are you able to formulate and deliver strategies focused on shaping our customers’ digital transformations?
Do you have a broad understanding of enterprise-class technologies with a particular focus on C# Developer?

We have an exciting role for you - join us as a C# Developer.


Careers at TCS: It means more
TCS is a purpose-led transformation company, built on belief. We don’t just help businesses to transform through technology. We support them in making a meaningful difference to the people and communities they serve - our clients include some of the biggest brands in Ireland and worldwide. For you, it means more opportunity to make an impact that matters, through challenging projects which demand ambitious innovation.
Shape the future of TCS.
Gain access to endless learning opportunities.
Collaborate with some of the leading lights of the industry.


The Role
As a C# Developer, you will work with the customer team to understand as-is state of application and design solutions.
Provide services for both Run the Company (RTC) and Change the Company (CTC).
Work as technology specialist and be responsible for setting up right technical architecture in delivery.
Collaborate closely with both customer business and IT team.
Participate in design discussions to develop technical interfaces, specifications, and architecture.
Analyse client business processes and functional requirements and provide impact analysis with new change requests.
Write clean, scalable, and testable code using .NET programming languages and review and refactor them.
Develop and maintain .NET applications.


Your Profile
Key skills/knowledge:
Knowledge of SQL server performance tuning (SQL Server 2008/2012/2014/2016).
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Experience required:
Extensive experience in C#, ASPX, SQL db, SSRS, JavaScript Frameworks like Angular 6+, Knockout JS or similar.
Proficiency in using Jira, Confluence.
Experience in building enterprise scale N-tier web application using Microsoft .NET technologies.
Expertise in performance tuning DB objects.
Proven experience in Agile application development.
Strong experience in DEvOps implementation.
Good to have:
Knowledge of banking or any financial domain.


Rewards & Benefits
TCS is consistently voted a Top Employer in the UK&I and globally. Our competitive salary packages feature pension, health care, life assurance, laptop, phone, access to extensive training resources and discounts within the larger Tata network.

Diversity, Inclusion & Wellbeing
At TCS, we believe in building and sustaining a culture of equity and belonging where everyone can thrive. Our diversity motto is ‘Inclusion without Exception’.

We encourage applications from all sections of society. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, sex, pregnancy and maternity, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

TCS is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to its employees and applicants for employment to ensure that individuals with disabilities enjoy equal access to all employment opportunities. If you are an applicant who needs an accommodation due to a disability to complete an employment application or during any phase of the hiring process, please contact us at krishnan.ajay@tcs.com with the subject line: "Disability Accommodation Request".

Due to a high volume of applications, we will be unable to contact each applicant individually regarding the status of their application. If you have not received a direct response within 30 days, then the application should be deemed unsuccessful. Job Type
Permanent

IT

Job ID: 153530
Required Travel :Minimal
Managerial - No
Location: Ireland- Dublin (Amdocs Site)

Who are we?

Amdocs helps those who build the future to make it amazing. With our market-leading portfolio of software products and services, we unlock our customers’ innovative potential, empowering them to provide next-generation communication and media experiences for both the individual end user and enterprise customers. Our 30,000 employees around the globe are here to accelerate service providers’ migration to the cloud, enable them to differentiate in the 5G era, and digitalize and automate their operations. Listed on the NASDAQ Global Select Market, Amdocs had revenue of $4.3 billion in fiscal 2021. For more information, visit Amdocs at www.amdocs.com

In one sentence

The UI Developer will work as part of a global team to transform the user interface of our Brite:Bill product using their expert experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript (especially ReactJS).

What will your job look like?

The Brite:Bill product is able to integrate a wide variety of different billing systems to produce customisable bills for end user customers, where customer information and behaviour is utilised to provide the correct information at the right time. Bills produced with this product save literally millions to Telco Companies, as their customers don´t need extra support coming from call centers.

Our product is used by many of the largest Telco companies in the world. Comcast, Sprint, AT&T, Vodafone, Rogers, to name a few. Technically, it was born as a monolithic application and thank to its' ongoing success, many new features have been added to support more and more customer needs.
The UI Developer will work with a cross-functional team to translate creative concepts into reality using their vast experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript technologies.
The role responsibilities will include but not be limited to:-
Providing technical implementation and documentation for user stories, tasks and defects, according to planning.
Participating actively in daily, refinement, planning and retrospective meetings within the team
Involvement in technical design as required.
Use of good practices and key patterns, assuring technical compliance with technical lead and software architect guidelines as well as project needs.
Assuring technical documentation is coherent and valuable for project and other product software engineers.
Technical code reviews and punctual technical project support.
When required, as subject matter expert, according to knowledge map:
Technical support to any team collaborating in technical designs, functional code reviews and punctual doubt resolution.Owner of the technical debt for a certain functional part of the platform: identification, classification, estimation, maintenance and risk communication.
All you need is...
Strong front end skills with HTML and CSS (SASS / LESS)
Experience in web application interface and best practices (object oriented web applications a plus).
Experience using the latest JavaScript frameworks, especially ReactJS.
Proficiency in JavaScript ES6, with knowledge of TypeScript and NodeJS a plus.
Understanding of view layout and rendering technologies (e.g., responsiveness, progressive enhancement, browser/device support).
Why you will love this job:
You will be challenged to design and develop new software applications.You will have the opportunity to work in a growing organization, with ever growing opportunities for personal growth.

The UI Developer will work as part of a global team to transform the user interface of our Brite:Bill product using their expert experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript (especially ReactJS).
 
What will your job look like?

The Brite:Bill product is able to integrate a wide variety of different billing systems to produce customisable bills for end user customers, where customer information and behaviour is utilised to provide the correct information at the right time. Bills produced with this product save literally millions to Telco Companies, as their customers don´t need extra support coming from call centers.

Our product is used by many of the largest Telco companies in the world. Comcast, Sprint, AT&T, Vodafone, Rogers, to name a few. Technically, it was born as a monolithic application and thank to its' ongoing success, many new features have been added to support more and more customer needs.
The UI Developer will work with a cross-functional team to translate creative concepts into reality using their vast experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript technologies.
The role responsibilities will include but not be limited to:-
Providing technical implementation and documentation for user stories, tasks and defects, according to planning.
Participating actively in daily, refinement, planning and retrospective meetings within the team
Involvement in technical design as required.
Use of good practices and key patterns, assuring technical compliance with technical lead and software architect guidelines as well as project needs.
Assuring technical documentation is coherent and valuable for project and other product software engineers.
Technical code reviews and punctual technical project support.
When required, as subject matter expert, according to knowledge map:
Technical support to any team collaborating in technical designs, functional code reviews and punctual doubt resolution.Owner of the technical debt for a certain functional part of the platform: identification, classification, estimation, maintenance and risk communication.

 All you need is...
Strong front end skills with HTML and CSS (SASS / LESS)
Experience in web application interface and best practices (object oriented web applications a plus).
Experience using the latest JavaScript frameworks, especially ReactJS.
Proficiency in JavaScript ES6, with knowledge of TypeScript and NodeJS a plus.
Understanding of view layout and rendering technologies (e.g., responsiveness, progressive enhancement, browser/device support).

 Why you will love this job:
You will be challenged to design and develop new software applications.You will have the opportunity to work in a growing organization, with ever growing opportunities for personal growth.

Job SummaryMedMedia Campaign is multi-award winning creative and digital agency specialising in the healthcare sector. We are looking to recruit a Web Designer & Developer who will help maintain our current suite of multi-channel applications as well as design and develop innovative, high-quality digital and creative products.The role requires someone who is fluent in digital design platforms, has real experience in web development/deployment and is willing to be creative in solving problems and finding solutions to our client's ideas.We cannot stress the importance of problem-solving here as our clients require a vast array of different requirements from maintaining legacy websites to localising global websites for the Irish and UK market, to building and hosting performative and beautiful products from scratch.Job Type / CategoryThis is a full-time position with a well-established business based in Dun Laoghaire, within a short walk from the DART.Our Ideal candidate:Has fluency in design platforms such as Figma and the Adobe suite.Has a love for digital design and development and is always on top of trends and new technologies.Can write organised and smart HTML, CSS and JS from scratch and has proven knowledge of modern libraries and frameworks.Has a portfolio of striking digital works from graphic design to live websites.Can maintain our current suite of websites and design solutions.Is happy to work on their own or as part of a tight knit team, depending on the project.Required Education, Skills and QualificationsKey Requirements:Degree in Computer Science or similar, with an impressive portfolio of works showing expertise and innovation in developing digital products.Minimum two years and ideally three years working experience in a relevant professional work environment.Experience with Javascript frameworks such as Vue and Angular.High level experience with Graphic Design, image editing, logo design, branding etc.High level experience and expertise in HTML5, CSS3 and JS.Expertise in Adobe products like Photoshop, Illustrator & InDesign.Experience with CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap or Foundation.Experience with CMS solutions such as Wordpress.Good understanding of prototyping techniques.A strong desire to learn and be a part of a collaborative team.The ability to be self-sufficient and able to direct yourself when needed.Nice-to-havesUnderstanding of version control with GIT; Object-oriented programming with PHP and RESTful APIs.Understanding of SQL and database engineering.Experience with Frontend dev tools such as Grunt, Gulp, NPM, Bower, Babel etc.Video editing with Premiere, Final Cut Pro and After Effects.Experience with developing and distributing HTML email.Ability to implement and analyse SEO and google analytics.Comfortable with Mac OS.BenefitsThe successful candidate will join a small but successful group, in a friendly working atmosphere and a blue-chip client base, in a great location, right beside the sea, with excellent rail and bus links.The position is open to a hybrid office/work-from-home scenario, pending a probation period of in-office onboarding.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: From €40,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Dún Laoghaire, Dublin, CO. Your Job
The IHP team is seeking an experienced full-stack software engineer to join a new team based in Dublin, Ireland in designing, building, and launching customizations to IHP necessary to drive product adoption across European markets. IHP includes a suite of web/mobile applications for screening, scheduling, and communicating with candidates to facilitate actual interviews with employers. This team will strongly influence how the core IHP product is designed for configurability across markets, which will require the team to understand the nuances of the various markets that IHP has launched in and tailor both employer and job seeker experiences accordingly.
We use rapid application development technology
We instrument our code liberally with analytics so we can see what’s happening
We release daily
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with designers, product managers and other engineers to design product experiences
Build applications using modern Javascript front-end frameworks (such as React) and update/consume back end services in Java
Continually improve our technical stack and processes
Maintain existing tools and infrastructure as necessary
Participate in usability testing
Help drive the technical direction of the product and mentor other team members
Who You Are
You will be responsible for entire projects, including working with a Product Manager and a UX Designer on the problem being solved, possible solutions, the UI design, implementation and analytics. You should possess a mix of technical strength, business strength and good product ideas.
We're looking for someone who:
Understands the end user and can build simple, elegant solutions
Thinks about why something needs to be built, not just what needs to be built
Loves to learn and develop new skills continuously
Is willing to work in a tech stack deemed most suitable for the project
Is excited to work on testing a variety of product ideas, either currently underway or conceived in the future.
Requirements:
BS or MS in Computer Science (or equivalent)
3+ years of experience developing web applications with a modern Javascript framework: React, Angular, or Vue
Experience with full stack application development, including services development in Java, is a plus
Excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills
Who we are
The Enterprise business organization is focused on delivering value for Indeed’s largest customers. We are driven by Indeed’s mission to help all people get jobs by helping enterprise employers make the best hires, at scale. Our work is very important to us as Enterprise employers are consistently rated among the top places to work globally. Our approach is multi-faceted with many dedicated product and engineering professionals driving innovation with our biggest clients in mind.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.
(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.
Salary Range Transparency
Dublin 58,000 - 84,000 EUR per year
Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement
Indeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritised. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to build a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnic background, race, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.
Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at +44 800 640 9982, or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview.

We are currently partnering with our client Horse Racing Ireland to recruit for IT DEVELOPER(S) who will be involved in an exciting project in a well-established IT team with flexible working conditions. This is a 24 Month contract hybrid role and will be based in the HRI Newbridge office.The software developer will be responsible for handling all aspects related to the provision of software solutions for Project Polaris, a software development project which will complete the phased re-development of HRI’s racing operating system. Reporting to the Business Applications Manager, the role will include design and development of architectural frameworks, from development using best practice in ASP.NET using C#, introducing new development frameworks in the .Net technology stack. The role includes ensuring that software systems are optimized for performance, and that the integrity and security is maintained to high standards, using industry best practice. Other responsibilities may include documenting technical specifications and production of automated testing scripts.Horse Racing Ireland (HRI) is a commercial semi-state body whose mission is to develop and promote Ireland as a world centre of excellence for horse racing and breeding. Our people and their passion for what they do is at the heart of our core values. Core Values: Respect, Ambition, Empowerment, Excellence, Integrity, Pride & Passion. Competencies: Customer Focus, Developing Self, Energy & Pace, Innovation & Change, Leadership, Team.Key Responsibilities:To keep up to date with best practice in Applications Development specifically Microsoft technologies using ASP.Netframeworks with C# as the development language and SQL Server as the database management system.To apply a range of technical competence to all assigned work in terms of:C#, ASP.NET Technology stack, Microsoft SQL Server, T-SQLXML and integration technologies, for example SSISSupport of & maintenance of Windows Web Server 2016+ /IIS8/8.5 and database design in terms of relational modellingTo undertake specific application assignments and deliver theses in accordance the software development lifecycle project management best practiceCan write technical specifications – translating user requirementsSupport, advise, clarify requirements, and collaborate with internal stakeholders.Resolve technical issues through debugging, research, and investigation.Support all other IT members as and when required to meet the project’s quality and service objectives.Keep abreast of best practices & appropriately network to broaden self-experience to be of business benefit – driving continuous improvement in our software development.Skills and Experience:Relevant Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.Minimum 5+ years of commercial experience as a Software Engineer building and delivering scalable solutions using C#.NETDatabase experience using Microsoft SQL Server and Entity Framework.Experience with client-side web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery. Experience with Telerik Kendo framework would be hugely beneficial.Strong troubleshooting (debugging) and performance tuning skills.Experienced developer: your code is maintainable, elegant, and testable.Solid understanding of OOP (Object Oriented Programming) and computer science foundations.Exposure to & understanding of SOA-Service Oriented architecture.Pursues with energy, drive.Ability to problem solve and use initiative to generate effective solutions.Strong analytic and problem-solving skills; ability to learn quickly and clarify poorly defined problems.Strong interpersonal and communication skills.Desirable Skills and Experience:Microsoft Certified Solutions Developer (MCSD) certification.ASP.NET Core and MVC Frameworks knowledge.REST (HTTP, JSON) APIs with .NET and C# experience.Responsive frameworks (such as Bootstrap, Foundation etc.).Experience using Git.Knowledge of Azure DevOps.If you are interested in this vacancy, please send your curriculum vitae to the email address provided no later than close of business day, Friday the 26th of August 2022 by 17:00.We have a number of similar IT Developer positions currently, and in the future, which we would like to discuss with you should you indicate your interest in this role. Web Developer – Front End - Remote
Terminalfour is a digital engagement and web content management platform for higher education. We help universities and colleges drive student recruitment, retention, alumni fundraising, and research promotion by maximising the effectiveness of their digital and content strategies.
We're the No. 1 provider to the higher education sector in the UK and Ireland and we're quickly becoming the No. 1 provider in North America
This role will be remote. We will send you a laptop, monitors etc, whatever you need to get set up remotely, or you can avail of our Bring Your Own Device Policy and work from your own preferred equipment.
We believe in continuous learning, so if you want to enhance your AWS skills, the company will cover the cost of your training and AWS Certification.
We are focused on our employee wellbeing, and provide an Employee Assistance Programme to all staff, in all locations. This service provides support for a range of issues, as well as short term counselling, and is available to both employees and their families. In addition, we have a Wellbeing platform which is all about promoting health, wellbeing and generally taking care of ourselves.
Terminalfour offers remote working, flexible hours and 30 days annual leave.

The Role
This role involves integrating client websites into our enterprise-level content management system. You will be involved throughout the lifecycle of the project, integrating multiple websites into the CMS using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
You will be working as part of our Professional Services department, alongside a team of Analysts, Project Managers and Web Developers. The role is client-focused, therefore good communication is essential. This is a unique opportunity for you to work with clients on large scale projects, and to develop your skills with an exciting team.
What you will do:
Produce high quality CMS-driven sites from detailed functional specifications. Work with clients and Project Managers to ensure high-quality website designs and timely project deliverables.Develop maintainable and re-usable HTML/CSS/JS to address client needs.Work with our Implementation Analysts, advising on the estimation, design, development, and implementation of projectsThoroughly test these sites prior to client delivery.Write detailed client facing documentation for your work.
Skills and Experience you will need:
HTML/CSS/Sass/JavaScript skills: be comfortable with translating a high-fidelity design into HTML, CSS and JavaScript markup using Sass technologies.Accessibility knowledge working to WCAG/Section 508 standards.Experience using Bootstrap and/or Foundation frameworks.Experience of working with colleagues to develop project specifications.Self-motivated and organised, you enjoy the challenge of achieving tight deadlines in a project-driven environment.Strong communication skillsFluent English language skills
Good to have Skills and Experience:
Creative/artistic flair is an advantage.Experience with GIT (and /or other version control) is an advantage.
We look forward to hearing from you.
Terminalfour is an Equal Opportunities Employer.
We do not require Recruitment Agency Assistance with this role, thank you. Web Developer – Front End - Remote

As a Full Stack Developer in DropChef, you’ll be given the space and responsibility to lead development on new features, do deployments of our app and website, and make your mark on our service.We’re looking for someone who can work across the full stack, from writing database queries to wiring up a UI. You’ll be working with a React Native/Redux app, fetching data from a NestJS REST API, which connects with a Wordpress/WooCommerce CMS. You’ll be using modern tooling, working in a NX monorepo, hosted on GitHub.You’ll work on a breadth of interesting projects such as:Creating an interactive recipe feature for customersMaking a React Native Web build of the current app and adapting the UI for browserBuilding automated pipelines for app and web deploymentMigrating the current infrastructure to AWS and hosting a high availability solutionYou can view our full tech stack here: https://stackshare.io/dropchef/dropchefResponsibilities:Development of new features across the entire stack, and maintaining the current features of the siteDeploying new versions of the app to App Store / Play StoreWorking with our product and operations team designing and defining requirement for new features for both our customers and our staffWorking with our customer success team on solutions to any customer issuesAssisting the marketing team with our analytics solutionsHolding the code to a high quality standardAbility to work Unijobs on behalf of the HSE have a requirement for a Grade VI, Software Developer who will work as part of the HSE's (eHealth) A2i-HIDs Division. This is a temporary role on an initial 6-month contract and will be a Flexible/WFH arrangement. The successful candidate will work 35 hours per week, paid an hourly rate of €26.85 based on an annualised salary of €49,041 and will also accrue 30 days paid annual leave.
A2i-HIDs has responsibility for ensuring integration and interoperability across health systems by developing, managing, and supporting services which enable timely access to health information when and where it is needed.
Working within the A2i-HIDs team provides an opportunity to work with talented engineers, developers and project support members who are passionate about what they do. Purpose, autonomy, and community are at the core values of the team and your role will contribute directly to the design and implementation of key components of critical infrastructure supporting unique health platforms and services enabling eHealth Ireland solution. Each team is empowered to utilise new and emerging technologies to ensure the health service is at the forefront of transformational technology. In this highly innovative environment, the answer may be a bespoke solutions to solve a unique problem or a new tool which can scale across the organisation. Projects are customer focused and, in an environment where priorities shift quickly, every day brings new and exciting challenges on the job
Principal Duties & Responsibilities
Write clean, scalable, testable and maintainable code using .NET programming languages and frameworks
Review, response and implementation of change requests to agreed scope
Work in a fast-paced Lean Agile team environment supporting and promoting key agile practices (Scrum) and living the ideals of continuous improvement
Participate in all agile ceremonies supporting and mentoring colleagues to deliver quality testable solutions.
Participate in peer reviews of your own and colleague's work
Managing the entire life cycle of application development, including analysis, design, specification, development, testing, deployment and support
Development of technical guidance documentation as needed for delivery partners and consumer system suppliers
Status reporting and escalation of identified or anticipated issues
Attendance at any meetings / workshops / presentations as required which are related to consumer system interfacing and data processing requests
Essential Post Specific Requirements
Minimum of 3+ years' experience implementing web, service and data related projects in support of complex messaging and data intensive systems
3rd level degree or equivalent in a computer science related discipline
Required Experience for the Role
3+ Years' experience in Software Development role (C#, .Net)
Translating business requirements into logical, functional, cohesive maintainable code
Experience with data driven web applications including developing for cloud environments such as Azure and or AWS
Experience designing and developing web applications using AngularJS, HTML, Web API 2, Blazer and Azure application services
SQL, PL\SQL, T-SQL (writing and debugging queries)
Experience delivering RESTful and RPC APIs with knowledge of micro service architecture
Experience working with source control systems such as GIT, branching strategies, AML tools such as Azure DevOps / Jira and IDE's (Visual Studio)
Experience and real world understanding of:
Software development and product lifecycles
Database design
Debugging, fault finding and remediation
IT, information, cyber security considerations when implementing secure solutions
Experience working in collaborative agile team environments (Scrum, XP)
Additional Experience in the following would be Advantageous
Certifications in Microsoft technology
Exposure to test-driven approaches as part of your development workflow such as TDD
Systems integration, data processing and ETL experience
Exposure to micro service architecture and implementing scalable and independently deployable components
Experience of Healthcare messaging protocols and interoperability standards HL7 / XML / FHIR / JSON
Desired Characteristics
Passion for remaining up to date with the terminology, concepts and best practices for quality software delivery
Can take the initiative and lead by example
Excellent communication and ability to work with a range of stakeholders inside and across the wider business and solution venders
Experience working with multinational companies and teams
Can bridge the gap between user domain and technical audiences
Strong Innovative/creative thinking
Enthusiastic teamwork and process innovation driven
Strong design and systems thinking skills

Nitro is looking to hire an experienced Front End Engineer to join our eCommerce Products Team.

About Us:

Nitro is a global document productivity company accelerating digital transformation in a world that demands the ability to work from anywhere, anytime, on any device. As a global player in the eSign and workflow productivity market, Nitro enables organisations to drive better business outcomes through 100% digital document processes and fast, efficient workflows. The Nitro Productivity Platform offers comprehensive SaaS business solutions, including highly secure eSigning and e-ID, powerful PDF productivity and industry-leading analytics, all supported by a superior customer success team. Nitro has over 3 million licensed users and 13,000+ Business Customers in more than 150 countries, including over 68% of the Fortune 500 and three of the Fortune 10. Nitro is headquartered in San Francisco with nine global hubs.

Why Nitro Engineering:

Engineering is a critical function at Nitro, developing the products and services at the heart and soul of our business today, and helping us realize our vision of smarter documents in the future. We have an incredibly talented and diverse Engineering team that cares, with a strong culture that believes in building the right things and building them the right way.

What you'll be doing:

Collaborating with Product Management, Engineering and Design to build a product that will enable our users to purchase our offerings and manage their entitlements on our system
Building elegant interfaces that deliver amazing customer experiences
Building modular, testable, and reusable Javascript components
Building automated end to end tests
Building deployment workflows to support continuous delivery
Researching new front-end technologies to drive innovation
Evaluating the existing application codebase and driving improvement
Evangelizing best practices and standards

Experience & Qualifications:

2+ years experience as a Front End Engineer or equivalent
2+ years building browser-based rich user interface applications
Professional experience with CSS and CSS pre-processors (Less, Sass, or similar)
Ability to translate a high-level open-ended requirement into a working prototype with real data
Professional experience with end-to-end test automation frameworks
Expertise in Javascript and Typescript (using modern frameworks) e.g. Angular v7, Vue.js
Professional experience with responsive design specifically targeting mobile web browsers
Professional experience integrating with internal and external RESTful services
Professional experience with npm or similar package management tools
Professional experience with Webpack or similar build tools
Good understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and solutions for modern browsers
Ability to advocate for front-end development standards, design patterns, and best practices

 Nice to have:

Experience with eCommerce
Experience working in Java or Scala (functional programming approach)
Experience with asynchronous / event driven architectures

How We Work:

Our mission is to help create, develop, and support an environment where great people come to do their best work. We believe there is a balance to strike between "work hard, play hard," and we strive to improve in both areas every day.

We put our customers, employees, and communities at the center of everything we do. It all comes back to our core values:

Be Good - Nitronauts are good humans with big hearts that are respectful and supportive of each other. We celebrate individuality and diversity and strive to foster an environment where people can be themselves and do their best work.
Performance First - We like to challenge ourselves. We're passionate about exceeding expectations and stepping outside our comfort zones to get to the next level. It's our ambition that pushes us to work hard and deliver strong results.
No B.S. - This one is self-explanatory, but we're all about transparency, honesty, and authenticity here. We don't beat around the bush; we tell it like it is.

Why Nitro?

Our goal is to empower our Nitronauts—to make an impact, work better together, and believe any goal is attainable. We take pride in the perks and benefits provided to employees that make their day-to-day lives more enjoyable and secure. Along with competitive comp and equity, and in addition to our regular benefits and programs (including health, dental, vision, retirement as standard), we are also very proud to offer a few additional initiatives to future Nitronauts:

Flex Time Off
Work-life balance is important at Nitro, and we understand that there are events that we cannot plan for. We are proud to offer Flex Time Off to be used for holidays, spending days with your family, or appointments.

Flexible Forever
We will offer a flexible work environment forever. This hybrid approach allows our team the flexibility to work remotely and have access to in-person time for collaboration sessions and team offsites.

90 Days Away
We offer the opportunity for employees to travel and explore while working from anywhere. Employees can extend vacations and spend more time with family, and work from anywhere for up to 90 days.

Nitro Resource Groups
Nitro supports our diverse group of Nitronauts who come together to celebrate their passions, share their unique perspectives, experiences, and contributions to make Nitro a more inclusive place to work.

Families @ Nitro
We have the opportunity and responsibility to ensure the well-being of our employees, which includes offering support when and where it matters most. From generous leave to fertility benefits, Nitro supports team members who may be on or considering a path to parenthood, whatever that looks like.

We strongly encourage applications from everyone regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. Nitro provides an accessible candidate experience. If you need any accommodations or adjustments throughout the interview process and beyond, please let us know. #gonitro #LI-NS1 #LI-Remote Nitro is looking to hire an experienced Front End Engineer to join our eCommerce Products Team.

Nitro supports our diverse group of Nitronauts who come together to celebrate their passions, share their unique perspectives, experiences, and contributions to make Nitro a more inclusive place to work.

Families @ Nitro
We have the opportunity and responsibility to ensure the well-being of our employees, which includes offering support when and where it matters most. From generous leave to fertility benefits, Nitro supports team members who may be on or considering a path to parenthood, whatever that looks like.

We strongly encourage applications from everyone regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. Nitro provides an accessible candidate experience. If you need any accommodations or adjustments throughout the interview process and beyond, please let us know. #gonitro #LI-NS1 #LI-Remote How We Work:

Our mission is to help create, develop, and support an environment where great people come to do their best work. We believe there is a balance to strike between "work hard, play hard," and we strive to improve in both areas every day.

We put our customers, employees, and communities at the center of everything we do. It all comes back to our core values:

Be Good - Nitronauts are good humans with big hearts that are respectful and supportive of each other. We celebrate individuality and diversity and strive to foster an environment where people can be themselves and do their best work.
Performance First - We like to challenge ourselves. We're passionate about exceeding expectations and stepping outside our comfort zones to get to the next level. It's our ambition that pushes us to work hard and deliver strong results.
No B.S. - This one is self-explanatory, but we're all about transparency, honesty, and authenticity here. We don't beat around the bush; we tell it like it is.

Why Nitro?

Our goal is to empower our Nitronauts—to make an impact, work better together, and believe any goal is attainable. We take pride in the perks and benefits provided to employees that make their day-to-day lives more enjoyable and secure. Along with competitive comp and equity, and in addition to our regular benefits and programs (including health, dental, vision, retirement as standard), we are also very proud to offer a few additional initiatives to future Nitronauts:

Flex Time Off
Work-life balance is important at Nitro, and we understand that there are events that we cannot plan for. We are proud to offer Flex Time Off to be used for holidays, spending days with your family, or appointments.

Flexible Forever
We will offer a flexible work environment forever. This hybrid approach allows our team the flexibility to work remotely and have access to in-person time for collaboration sessions and team offsites.

90 Days Away
We offer the opportunity for employees to travel and explore while working from anywhere. Employees can extend vacations and spend more time with family, and work from anywhere for up to 90 days.

Job Details
Job Title: Full-stack Developer
Job Type: Permanent
Location: Dublin, Ireland (3 days a week in the office)

Are you able to formulate and deliver strategies focused on shaping our customers’ digital transformations?
Do you have a broad understanding of enterprise-class technologies with a particular focus on a full-stack environment?

We have an exciting role for you - join us as a Full Stack Developer.


Careers at TCS: It means more
TCS is a purpose-led transformation company, built on belief. We don’t just help businesses to transform through technology. We support them in making a meaningful difference to the people and communities they serve - our clients include some of the biggest brands in Ireland and worldwide. For you, it means more opportunity to make an impact that matters, through challenging projects which demand ambitious innovation.
Shape the future of TCS.
Gain access to endless learning opportunities.
Collaborate with some of the leading lights of the industry.


The Role

As a Full-stack Developer, you will work with the customer team to understand as-is state of application and design solutions.
Perform hands-on coding using Java/J2EE and unit testing.
Design, develop, and implement web-based Java applications to support business requirements.
Follow approved life cycle methodologies, creates design documents, and performs program coding and testing.
Resolves technical issues through debugging, research, and investigation.
Contribute to the design and development of high-quality software for large scale Java/Spring Batch/Micro-service Applications.


Your Profile
Key skills/knowledge:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks – Angular JS.
Familiarity with NoSQL database technology – MongoDB.
Ability to prototype experiences, including the ability to gauge the appropriate fidelity for the objective.
Skilled at explaining your work, process, and decisions to cross-functional stakeholders.


Experience required:
Experience in designing business and developer-focused products.
Strong relevant design experience at a tech, product-driven company.
Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages – HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Proficiency with server-side languages/frameworks – Java/J2EE/Spring.


Rewards & Benefits
TCS is consistently voted a Top Employer in the UK&I and globally. Our competitive salary packages feature pension, health care, life assurance, laptop, phone, access to extensive training resources and discounts within the larger Tata network.

Diversity, Inclusion & Wellbeing
At TCS, we believe in building and sustaining a culture of equity and belonging where everyone can thrive. Our diversity motto is ‘Inclusion without Exception’.

We encourage applications from all sections of society. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, sex, pregnancy and maternity, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

TCS is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to its employees and applicants for employment to ensure that individuals with disabilities enjoy equal access to all employment opportunities. If you are an applicant who needs an accommodation due to a disability to complete an employment application or during any phase of the hiring process, please contact us at krishnan.ajay@tcs.com with the subject line: "Disability Accommodation Request".

Due to a high volume of applications, we will be unable to contact each applicant individually regarding the status of their application. If you have not received a direct response within 30 days, then the application should be deemed unsuccessful. Job Type

I am looking for a Remote PHP Developer to join a well-established internet company based in Ireland.

BENEFITS :up to €50,000, 23 days holiday plus bank holidays (rising with service), free parking, pension, life cover and health cover - fully remote, flexible working hours, standard working hours 9-5.30pm with 1 hour for lunch

An internet company is looking to grow their already established development team and are looking for a Developer who has experience developing applications and software using PHP with JavaScript to develop the core applications for the company.

They are looking to train up the right developer on their full-stack and systems, so need someone who is eager to learn new skills and technologies. And due to the nature of the business, this will include learning of the protocols of internet technologies such as HTTP, SMTP, FTP, SSH, TLS and DNS. They will also be getting you up to speed with dependency and package management solutions for both PHP and JavaScript, and be teaching you asynchronous JavaScript with Promises.

The company are a passionate team of developers and are one of the largest internet companies in the Europe. They provide award winning solutions and have can boast achieving many industry firsts. The company hosts a dynamic and unique environment and are looking for developers who are keen to keep up to date with emerging technologies and help improve existing systems, and extend product ranges.

This role will be full remote.

Key Skills
Experience with OO PHP
Solid understanding of software design patterns and principles
Core JavaScript experience and understanding of concepts such as prototypal inheritance
Experience with relational databases
Experience with writing modular reusable code, not limited to any framework
Unit testing experience with PHPUnit
Experience with CSS and HTML
Great communication skills, written and verbal
High Attention to detail
Ability to work to tight deadlines
Bonus Skills
Experience with Agile software development
Experience with RESTful Web Service
Asynchronous JavaScript
NoSQL databases (Memcache, Redis or Elasticsearch)
Knowledge of the protocols of internet technologies (HTTP, SMTP, FTP, SSH, TLS and DNS)
Experience with PHP Standards Recommendations
Experience with NoSQL Databases (Redis, Elasticsearch, Memcache)
If you're interested in this role, please send a copy of your CV or through the link. Alternatively, please call Lauren on 01332 317216 for a confidential chat. I am looking for a Remote PHP Developer to join a well-established internet company based in Ireland.

The company hosts a dynamic and unique environment and are looking for developers who are keen to keep up to date with emerging technologies and help improve existing systems, and extend product ranges.

This role will be full remote.

Key Skills
Experience with OO PHP
Solid understanding of software design patterns and principles
Core JavaScript experience and understanding of concepts such as prototypal inheritance
Experience with relational databases

Unit testing experience with PHPUnit
Experience with CSS and HTML
Great communication skills, written and verbal
High Attention to detail
Ability to work to tight deadlines
Bonus Skills
Experience with Agile software development
Experience with RESTful Web Service
Asynchronous JavaScript
NoSQL databases (Memcache, Redis or Elasticsearch)
Knowledge of the protocols of internet technologies (HTTP, SMTP, FTP, SSH, TLS and DNS)
Experience with PHP Standards Recommendations
Experience with NoSQL Databases (Redis, Elasticsearch, Memcache)

Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services.
Job Summary
The Senior Python developer is a part of the multi-functional Blueface Technology Team and is instrumental in the full software development life-cycle. This includes, but is not limited to, requirement gathering, design and development through to deployment and post-release. The role has scope to evolve based on the candidate’s desire to learn and become involved in other technical fields. This position would have more experience and responsibility in ongoing projects than a standard back end developer.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Develop and test algorithms to solve complex business problems.
Design and build complex data to support new business initiatives.
Employ the latest techniques such as Agile Software Development.
Writing the web services and APIs used by developers and mobile application developers
Server-side web application logic as well as the integration of front-end part aspects
Preferred Skills:
Python proficiency is essential
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English
Git
Celery
Redis
Experience with RabbitMQ or another AMQP broker
Relational database systems. E.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL
Python web frameworks. eg Flask, Django
Python object-relational mapping libraries. eg sqlalchemy, storm
Agile Software Development (tools like Jira, etc)
Exceptional Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills
Proven Experience Developing for LINUX
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced development schedule
#blueface
Disclaimer:
This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.

Education
Bachelor's Degree
While possessing the stated degree is preferred, Comcast also may consider applicants who hold some combination of coursework and experience, or who have extensive related professional experience.
Certifications (if applicable)
Relative Work Experience
7-10 Years

Job Summary
Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Edits new and existing applications. Implements, testing and debugging defined software components. Documents all development activity. Works with moderate guidance in own area of knowledge.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Analyzes and determines integration needs.
Evaluates and plans software designs, test results and technical manuals.

Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.

Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services.

We're a small but determined team building the best recruitment software for small and medium size businesses. We need somebody who can wrap their arms around it and delivery a great experience for our customers.
If you'd like to play a big part in a small company and you have 2+ years backend experience with .NET and Azure we'd love to hear from you.
We take a domain driven design (DDD) approach for both the frontend and backend, this lets us have the concerns identified and separated making both of our codebases clean and easy to navigate.
Our stack includes uses:
.NET core for the API
TypeScript, Svelte, Tailwind and Vite for the frontend
Containers and serverless functions
Azure hosting and services
Azure Search
SQL database and Table storage
What you might like:
We're based in Ireland but open to a fully remote role
We don't have layers of management
We don't have many meetings so you'll be coding most of the time
You get a massive amount of autonomy
We treat our people with respect
This is an opportunity to get in and make your mark
What you will be doing:
Developing new features from the product roadmap
Integrating HireHive with other SaaS solutions
Maintain and develop open source libraries
What we're ideally looking for:
2+ years professional experience in .NET/C# or similar language
2+ years of professional experience in web application development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) using modern front-end frameworks (Svelte, Vue.js, React)
Knowledge of HTML standards and browsers API's
Self motivated and able to work on your own
Understands what good UX is and attention to detail
Good communication skills and comfortable in a small team
You’re eager to learn, suggest improvements, and have the capacity to implement them
Experience and genuine interest in SaaS

We are looking for team-oriented Progress OOD Web Developers, based in Dublin, with a can-do attitude to work on diverse and exciting new innovative global projects. Responsibilities you will have in the role are to undertake the full development lifecycle of a global WMS application and to produce high quality software solutions within time and budget.
About the Role
How you will contribute
Undertake the full development lifecycle of a global WMS application.
Produce high quality software solutions within time and budget.
Provide support of existing applications to an agreed SLA.
Work within a team and focus on continuous improvement and learning.
Create innovative solutions to problems.
Facilitate and support onsite deployments of major projects.
Other duties as assigned.
Your Key Qualifications
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
Experience as a Software Developer, Software Engineer or similar role.
Exposure to querying relational databases.
Progress OOD experience would be beneficial.
Knowledge of coding languages (e.g. Java, JavaScript) and frameworks/systems (e.g. AngularJS, Git).
Working knowledge of Unix / Linux Operating System and commands.
The ability to work under pressure and deliver to changing business demands.
At syncreon we are fully committed to the health and safety of our employees. We have full prevention and mitigation processes in place, including cleaning and sanitization practices, as well as screenings, masks and social distancing. syncreon complies with national, state and local orders.
Compensation
syncreon offers exciting and challenging roles within a growing international organization. We strive to hire and develop the right people, locally and globally; stimulating personal growth and self-development within an informal atmosphere. We offer a market competitive compensation package.
About syncreon
At syncreon, we partner with customers, such as Jaguar Land Rover, Harley Davidson, BMW, Dell, Xerox and Canon to provide specialized logistics, operational excellence and value added solutions in: Fulfillment, eCommerce & Value-Add Solutions, Manufacturing Support & Assembly Services, Export Packing, Transportation Management and Reverse, Repair & Service Parts.
We specialize in the design and operation of supply chain solutions for Automotive, Technology, Consumer Home Products, Industrial, Healthcare & MedTech companies. Today we have 14,000+ employees working in 100+ locations worldwide who enjoy our supportive culture, dedication to work-life balance, people development and superb career opportunities.
Note
Candidates chosen to move forward within the Recruitment Process may be required to undergo an assessment and/or submit further background information. Any offers of employment may be conditional on completion of required checks and provision of relevant documentation, in accordance with the applicable local legislation. Interested in joining a Med-Tech Company scaling at an exponential rate? My client is a company who powers Medical Staff to save lives.
Through their cloud-based platform, this company delivers the infrastructure that underpins the entire service, from diagnosis to surgery and discharging of patients.
With big plans ahead it is certainly the right time to join the company!
Responsibilities:
Developer & Implement UI components via. React.js concepts and work-flows such as Redux, Flux, and Webpack.
Responsible for profiling and improving front-end performance and documenting front-end code-base.
Skills
5+ Year's Experience working as a React.js developer.
In-depth knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, HTML, and front-end frameworks.
Knowledge/ Prior Experience with REACT tools including React.js, Webpack, Redux, Flux, etc.
Experience working within UI Design.
Locations: Dublin City Centre
Workplace Type: Hybrid/ On-site (On boarding done In-Office)

Company Description
Etsy is the global marketplace for unique and creative goods. We build, power, and evolve the tools and technologies that connect entrepreneurs with buyers around the world. Etsy, Inc.'s 'house of brands' portfolio has expanded to now include four individually distinct ecommerce brands - Etsy, fashion resale marketplace Depop, musical instrument marketplace Reverb, and Brazil-based handmade goods marketplace Elo7. As an Etsy employee, you'll tackle unique problems alongside talented coworkers committed to Keeping Commerce Human. We're large enough that you'll focus on meaningful, complex challenges, but small enough that you can make a rewarding impact.

Job Description
What’s the role?
Our International Experience product group is looking for Software Engineers to collaborate in building trustworthy software and outstanding user experiences. There are diverse and varying disciplines within our group. We are looking for talented and driven people to join the Etsy family and take our vision of “Making Etsy Safe Globally” to the next level.
Here’s a taste of the problems we’re solving:
How can we make it safer and simpler for sellers to run their shops?
How do we ensure the buyer experience is localised to where you are shopping or selling from?
Diversifying the methods of Payments we allow for our checkout experience.
Ensuring that our sellers “are who they say they are” to make purchases even safer.
How can we ensure that every Etsy product developer can reach a global audience in their language and with their cultural expectations?
This is a full-time position reporting to the Senior Engineering Manager, New Markets. This role requires your presence in Etsy’s Dublin office in an in-person or flex capacity. Learn more about our Flex and Office-based work modes as well as vaccination policy here.
What does the day-to-day look like?
You will contribute at all levels of our web application stack, ranging from front-end web interfaces (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Typescript, React) to back-end technologies (PHP, MySQL, BigQuery). We do not expect you to have complete expertise of our stack before you join us; we all learn on the job.
Of course, this is just a sample of the kinds of work this role will require! You should assume that your role will encompass other tasks, too, and that your job duties and responsibilities may change from time to time at Etsy's discretion, or otherwise applicable with local law.

Qualifications
Qualities that will help you thrive in this role are:
You have experience working on a large scale, high performance and fault-tolerant systems.
You're an engineer who can turn ideas into extremely fast and reliable code that other people - or you, six months into the future - will find easy to comprehend and modify.
You care as much about building phenomenal products as you do writing great code.
You have a “leave it better than you found it” mentality, and are willing to work with and improve on code you did not originally write.
Have a knack for organization and breaking down large problems into smaller ones.
Can be autonomous and a fast learner.
You are a mindful, transparent, and communicative member of your team.
Can spin yarns about how you've done this right and wrong at your previous job(s). And we'll give bonus points if you can actually spin yarn.
Enjoy learning about and interacting with the people who use your product.
Additional Information

What's Next
If you're interested in joining the team at Etsy, please send a cover letter and resume telling us why you'd be right for the position. As you've hopefully seen already, Etsy is a place that values individuality and variety. We don't want you to be like everyone else - we want you to be like you! So write to us and tell us what you're all about.
Our Promise
At Etsy, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. Etsy is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. While Etsy supports visa sponsorship, sponsorship opportunities may be limited to certain roles and skillsets.
For U.S. roles only:
Many Etsy roles are open to remote candidates, and you'll be able to identify which ones within the location header of each job description. We're open to remote hires from all U.S. states except Hawaii and Alaska. For candidates who will work remotely from Colorado, visit this link for information related to Colorado's Equal Pay for Equal Work Act. Company Description
Etsy is the global marketplace for unique and creative goods. We build, power, and evolve the tools and technologies that connect entrepreneurs with buyers around the world. Etsy, Inc.'s 'house of brands' portfolio has expanded to now include four individually distinct ecommerce brands - Etsy, fashion resale marketplace Depop, musical instrument marketplace Reverb, and Brazil-based handmade goods marketplace Elo7. As an Etsy employee, you'll tackle unique problems alongside talented coworkers committed to Keeping Commerce Human. We're large enough that you'll focus on meaningful, complex challenges, but small enough that you can make a rewarding impact.

Job Description
What’s the role?
Our International Experience product group is looking for Software Engineers to collaborate in building trustworthy software and outstanding user experiences. There are diverse and varying disciplines within our group. We are looking for talented and driven people to join the Etsy family and take our vision of “Making Etsy Safe Globally” to the next level.
Here’s a taste of the problems we’re solving:
How can we make it safer and simpler for sellers to run their shops?
How do we ensure the buyer experience is localised to where you are shopping or selling from?
Diversifying the methods of Payments we allow for our checkout experience.
Ensuring that our sellers “are who they say they are” to make purchases even safer.
How can we ensure that every Etsy product developer can reach a global audience in their language and with their cultural expectations?
This is a full-time position reporting to the Senior Engineering Manager, New Markets. This role requires your presence in Etsy’s Dublin office in an in-person or flex capacity. Learn more about our Flex and Office-based work modes as well as vaccination policy here.
What does the day-to-day look like?
You will contribute at all levels of our web application stack, ranging from front-end web interfaces (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Typescript, React) to back-end technologies (PHP, MySQL, BigQuery). We do not expect you to have complete expertise of our stack before you join us; we all learn on the job.
Of course, this is just a sample of the kinds of work this role will require! You should assume that your role will encompass other tasks, too, and that your job duties and responsibilities may change from time to time at Etsy's discretion, or otherwise applicable with local law.

Qualifications
Qualities that will help you thrive in this role are:
You have experience working on a large scale, high performance and fault-tolerant systems.
You're an engineer who can turn ideas into extremely fast and reliable code that other people - or you, six months into the future - will find easy to comprehend and modify.
You care as much about building phenomenal products as you do writing great code.
You have a “leave it better than you found it” mentality, and are willing to work with and improve on code you did not originally write.
Have a knack for organization and breaking down large problems into smaller ones.
Can be autonomous and a fast learner.
You are a mindful, transparent, and communicative member of your team.
Can spin yarns about how you've done this right and wrong at your previous job(s). And we'll give bonus points if you can actually spin yarn.
Enjoy learning about and interacting with the people who use your product.
Additional Information

Spectrum.Life supports 1,250+ companies in their health and wellness strategies. We support Employers, Universities and Insurers in looking after the mental health and wellbeing needs of over 1,000,000 users.
We are a healthcare company first. We focus on clinical efficacy and outcomes as our prime responsibility. We do this by providing or enabling best-in-class services, delivered by fully accredited, experienced professionals through our in-house built technology.
Our mission is to build a team to enhance and deliver our digital and onsite wellness to companies and employees around the world.
ROLE BRIEF
We are looking for an ambitious Front-End Developer for our ever-expanding team. If you are hardworking and dedicated, then Spectrum.Life is a great place to grow your career. Apply today!
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop new user-facing using Vue.js as primary front-end framework.
Build reusable code and libraries for future use.
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability.
Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

DESIRABLE:
Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery and advanced JavaScript frameworks, specifically Vue.js
Strong proficiency and understanding of HTML5, CSS3 and CSS frameworks
Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS
Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX
Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus.
Ability to take direction from UI/UX designer to incorporate expected design deliverables on web applications. Sometimes required to make some small adjustments or provisional changes without design.
Solid understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.
Experience working with code versioning tools, specifically git
Minimum 3 years experience working in front-end web development
Minimum B.Sc or B.A in Computer Science or related programming course.
Design qualifications are desirable but not required
WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SPECTRUM.LIFE
Full time permanent contract
Salary: Dependent on experience.

This role will involve working on a wide variety of web and mobile projects for clients ranging from small business and NGOs to enterprise size organisations. You will be reporting to our Senior Development manager. Professional experience is desired but is not essential if you can provide evidence of appropriate educational qualifications and projects you have worked on.

Skills required / desired:

– PHP development experience, particularly with WordPress, Laravel and CodeIgniter.
– Android Native app development experience (Kotlin experience a plus).
– Front end development experience, particularly with VueJS.
– TDD experience a huge plus.

Ideally we would like to see some of your code so please give us access to a Git repository or sample of code you’ve worked on.

We are located in Dublin city centre close to Luas, Dart, Irish Rail and Dublin Bikes services.

Please send CVs to jobs@fusio.net – we’re looking forward to hearing from you

Company Description
“Version 1 is celebrating 25 years in the IT industry this year and we continue to be trusted by global brands to deliver IT solutions that drive customer success.
Version 1 is not just a Microsoft Gold Partner, an AWS Premier Consulting Partner and an Oracle Platform Partner; we are also an award-winning employer and our employees are at the heart of Version 1. We invest in a strong culture of wellness through programs that help our employees create their journey toward optimal wellbeing. This framework is based on the ‘Strength in Balance‘ theme and this seen again in our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging Team motto “Bring Your Difference“.”

Job Description
Version 1 is seeking highly accomplished and professional PHP Managed Services Consultant to join their multi-award winning consultancy organisation.
This exciting opportunity will see the candidate working within a team of experienced Oracle professionals, exercising and developing the wide range of necessary skills that distinguishes a rounded consultant:
Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle.
Develop, record, maintain and deploy new features of web-based PHP applications.
The technical ability to problem solve complex issues.
The flexibility to move between clients, projects, technologies.
A collaborative team member.
Effectively communicate technical issues to business users.
Ability to identify, recommend and implement continuous service improvements.
Client facing skills.

Qualifications
You will have:
Strong backend PHP development experience (preferably 4+ years)
PHP, JavaScript, Apache Web Server, PL/SQL or T-SQL
Experience with one or more of the following databases – Oracle, MS SQL Server, MySQL
Experience working in Windows and Linux environments
Source Control experience e.g. Git, github
Desirable Skills: CMS (Moodle, Wordpress etc.), Azure devops exp.
Additional Information
Before you apply, here are some of our benefits. We offer profit share, pension, private medical, flexible working policy and more. We offer incentives for accreditations and educational assistance for courses relevant to your role.
We offer employee recognition in the form of Excellence Awards and V1Ps which is awarded by your peers. Engagement is incredibly important with local engagement teams driving our engagement events! Company Description

Graduate Software developer - 60>70% remote working possible - Direct applicants only
8 West Consulting is one of the country’s largest software development organisations. The company has been operating successfully in Cork city since 1998. 8 West Consulting employ a wide range of technologies including Mobile (iOS, Android, Windows), Java SE/Java EE (WebLogic, WebSphere, Spring, Akka, Hibernate, GWT, etc.), Microsoft .NET (ASP.NET, C#, etc.), JavaScript (AngularJS, JQuery, dojo, etc.), various database management systems (MongoDB, Oracle, SQL Server, MySql, etc.). 8 West Consulting provides consultancy and leading edge software solutions for a wide variety of US, EU and UK based clients in the insurance, healthcare, retail and public sector markets.

For more on 8 West Consulting visit our website www.8west.ie
We are seeking energetic, driven Bachelor or Masters level graduate developers (class of 2021 or 2022 subject to course completion) for permanent positions at our development offices in Cork. These will be technically challenging and rewarding positions, on various client accounts, working on major n-tier enterprise applications. The roles will require interaction with other developers in the team, supports functions, and project management to develop robust, scalable, and highly performant systems. Good career progression opportunities attach to all 8 West roles.
Responsibilities

Requirements analysis & Application Design
Providing accurate estimates and timings to project managers
Delivery of application development using standard web development methodologies
Ensuring all QA procedures are satisfied in terms of process and documentation.

Technical Profile

Strong technical competence
Some knowledge and/or experience of Java and/or Net and C# or front end technologies

Personal Profile

We would like to receive applications from recent graduates from Masters programmes or Bachelor of Science (Software development or related) degrees
We need graduates who are articulate, confident, and self motivating
We particularly like people who share our passion for technology and software development
We prefer that you display excellent written and verbal English communication skills
You should be an innovative problem solver and should also have the ability to collaborate in a dynamic team environment
Candidates who apply must be eligible to work in Ireland holding either EU Citizenship or appropriate visa. Visa is required in advance of applying for this position. 8 West Consulting do not provide sponsorship for this role Graduate Software developer - 60>70% remote working possible - Direct applicants only

For more on 8 West Consulting visit our website www.8west.ie
We are seeking energetic, driven Bachelor or Masters level graduate developers (class of 2021 or 2022 subject to course completion) for permanent positions at our development offices in Cork. These will be technically challenging and rewarding positions, on various client accounts, working on major n-tier enterprise applications. The roles will require interaction with other developers in the team, supports functions, and project management to develop robust, scalable, and highly performant systems. Good career progression opportunities attach to all 8 West roles.
Responsibilities

Requirements analysis & Application Design
Providing accurate estimates and timings to project managers
Delivery of application development using standard web development methodologies
Ensuring all QA procedures are satisfied in terms of process and documentation.

Technical Profile

Strong technical competence
Some knowledge and/or experience of Java and/or Net and C# or front end technologies

Personal Profile

We would like to receive applications from recent graduates from Masters programmes or Bachelor of Science (Software development or related) degrees
We need graduates who are articulate, confident, and self motivating
We particularly like people who share our passion for technology and software development
We prefer that you display excellent written and verbal English communication skills
You should be an innovative problem solver and should also have the ability to collaborate in a dynamic team environment
Candidates who apply must be eligible to work in Ireland holding either EU Citizenship or appropriate visa. Visa is required in advance of applying for this position. 8 West Consulting do not provide sponsorship for this role Graduate Software developer - 60>70% remote working possible - Direct applicants only
