Job Description:
Job Title: Python Developer
Corporate Title: Vice President
Location: Dublin
Role Description:
We are looking for a talented senior Python developer to work in the Risk & Finance Technology team. You will be responsible for designing and developing web-based Python solutions to help solve complex business problems within one of the most interesting parts of one of the world’s largest banks. You will work closely with business users, business analysts and development colleagues to build best in class risk management solutions.
The Team:
Enterprise Risk & Finance Technology (ERFT) at Bank of America
Believes diversity makes us stronger so we can reflect, connect, and meet the diverse needs of our clients and employees around the world.
Is committed to building a workplace where every employee is welcomed and given the support and resources to perform their jobs successfully.
Wants to be a great place for people to work and strives to create an environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their goals.
Provides continuous training and development opportunities to help employees achieve their career goals, whatever their background or experience.
Is committed to advancing our tools, technology, and ways of working to better serve our clients and their evolving business needs.
Believes in responsible growth and is dedicated to supporting our communities by connecting them to the lending, investing, and giving them what they need to remain vibrant and vital.?
Core Skills:
Knowledge of Python, SQL
Object-Oriented Programming and design
Working in a Scrum/Agile environment
Experience with tools such as Git, JIRA, Ansible
Tech lead with experience working in teams 3-5 developers
Excellent communication, collaboration and problem-solving skills
Bank of America:
Every day, across the globe, our employees bring a commitment to our purpose and to driving responsible growth by living our values: deliver together, act responsibly, realize the power of our people and trust the team. A key aspect of driving responsible growth is doing so in a sustainable manner, a critical pillar of which is being a great place to work for our teammates.
In line with these values, in EMEA we have 9 Employee Networks, a wide range of Sports & Social clubs, and other development and networking opportunities so that you can enjoy a range of experiences and connect with colleagues across the bank. We also offer exclusive discounts to some of the most iconic cultural experiences for you to enjoy in your spare time outside of work. Learn more about our benefits here.
Good conduct and sound judgment is crucial to our long term success. It’s important that all employees in the organisation understand the expected standards of conduct and how we manage conduct risk. Individual accountability and an ownership mind-set are the cornerstones of our Code of Conduct and are at the heart of managing risk well.
We are an equal opportunity employer and ensure that no applicant is subject to less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, gender identity, marital status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origins, age, sexual orientation, socio-economic background, responsibilities for dependants, physical or mental disability. The Bank selects candidates for interview based on their skills, qualifications, and experience.
We strive to ensure that our recruitment processes are accessible for all candidates and encourage any candidates to tell us about any adjustment requirements. As part of our standard hiring process to manage risk, please note background screening checks will be conducted on all hires before commencing employment.

We are hiring a Frontend Developer to build high-quality interactive experiences across our growing portfolio of products, including web, apps, and digital products.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Deliver microsites, websites, interfaces for web applications, edits to websites/web pages and HTML emails
Provide high-quality, well-structured and well-documented code
Communicate effectively with creative leads, client counterparts and other members of the development team
Assist in mentoring junior developers by encouraging collaboration, participation, and creative thinking
Must demonstrate the ability to master new/emerging technologies and take initiative to offer technical direction and creative solutions
Flawless attention to detail and organisational skills
Co-ordinating development time and workload with the project management team
Skills, Knowledge & Experience:
Demonstrable web development experience, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Experience with VueJs (or other JavaScript frameworks such as React)
Ability to contribute and work effectively within a team
Experience in app development is an advantage but not essential
Experience interfacing with back-end technologies, frameworks, and services.
3+ years’ experience desirable
Why work here:
The company is the name of online retail financial services, and has a culture of ownership, collaboration and success
Hybrid working model
As a small company the rapport of staff is paramount and they place a big emphasis on the social interactions among workers
The role is based in Dublin 4, with excellent pay and benefits on offer including a group pension scheme We are hiring a Frontend Developer to build high-quality interactive experiences across our growing portfolio of products, including web, apps, and digital products.

A career at Arup offers you the chance to make a positive difference in the world. Independently owned and independently minded, Arup is the creative force at the heart of many of the world’s most prominent projects in the built environment. We believe that flexible arrangements, such as hybrid working, create a more inclusive way of working that supports our diversity and the wellbeing of our people.
We are truly global and our 15,000 planners, designers, engineers and consultants around the world deliver innovative projects with creativity and passion. We have over 650 staff members working in Ireland with offices in Dublin, Cork, Galway and Limerick.

Senior Web Developer
This role is open for multiple locations (Cork, Dublin and Galway)
This role provides an opportunity to join a successful organization, that is heavily investing in digital transformation, to fill a pivotal role in its growth and success and to help our clients understand and leverage their data through the production of innovative solutions, including web and mobile applications, data visualisations, data analytics platforms, dashboards, and multimedia solutions. This is a great opportunity to contribute to a growing software development team that is delivering solutions for Arup Europe and its clients.

Your responsibilities
Develop web frontend applications, backend APIs/services and data visualizations, for both internal and external clients.
Lead a team of developers (frontend. ; UI/UX ; automation)
Collaborate and build relationships with our other development teams in Europe
Be a technical leader who can drive and challenge and shape our technical direction, independently solving technical problems, while steering a multi-functional team, to a common goal.
Define project scope and schedules, lead project planning meetings, manage client and stakeholder expectations, and implement effective project governance.
Delivering solutions to a given timeframe and within budget

Essential Experience and Knowledge
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field and at least 5+ years in a web development role, and someone who wishes to take the next step and gain experience in leading a development team.
Solid experience of modern web development tools and frameworks.
Independently to solve technical problems is required
We have a portfolio of solutions, so context switching and the ability to work across many projects at a time is a must
Excellent collaborator and communicator within the team and wider stakeholders
You are adaptable to new ways of working
Ability to balance and prioritize multiple conflicting requirements with high attention to detail

Preferred Technologies
Languages: Node js ; React ; Express ; JavaScript and Python
Database: MSSql ; PostgreSQL
Governance: Jira ; Agile ; CI/CD ; GIT
Cloud: AWS

What to expect at Arup:
A multicultural and informal working environment where you can develop professionally by being part of a team who enjoy what they do.
Opportunities for short or long assignments at Arup’s offices and projects anywhere in the world.
Employees are eligible for the Global Profit Share scheme, which is dependent on the firm’s financial performance.
Competitive performance-based salary growth.
A strong corporate culture committed to its values: quality of work, holistic approach, humane organization, straight and honourable dealings, social usefulness and reasonable prosperity.
Continuous training and professional development that will allow you to adapt to the growing needs of our clients as we embrace digital transformation.

Join us in shaping a better world.
Our goal is to shape a better world, finding solutions for some of the world’s most complex problems. From climate action to social value, we consider the most expansive impacts of our work. Our drive to build a more sustainable, resilient and equitable future shapes our culture and has made us leaders in sustainable development. The successful candidate will join our multi-disciplinary design teams focusing on technical excellence and innovative solutions that create a better future for people, places, and the planet.
'A better way'- Sustainability and Social Equity
At Arup, we strive to bring environmental sustainability and social equity together. We put sustainability at the heart of our projects and invest in research and development that helps tackle issues such as climate change and poverty. We have made a commitment to reach net zero by 2030 and to contribute meaningfully to the UN Sustainable Development Goals, creating shared value for our clients and our communities while safeguarding our planet. Read our net zero carbon plan here. Read our net zero carbon plan here.
A career at Arup gives you the chance to have a positive impact on the world. For us, corporate responsibility is not just a policy; it’s a way of working.
Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion is at the heart of what we do
We are committed to creating an inclusive working environment for talented people of any background based on merit, fairness and respect. At Arup, you’ll be a welcomed member of the team with opportunities to participate in social, cultural and educational events with the local community (e.g. as a STEM ambassador) or with your colleagues by joining staff networks such as those for women, culture or the LGBTQ+ community.
We are a certified CPD accredited employer with Engineers Ireland

#LI-MM1 Show more

BearingPoint Business Services is a complete product development team where you will find dedicated colleagues in different key areas: Business Analysis, User Experience, Development, Testing and Service Maintenance. The main focus is innovation, so you will work with cutting edge technologies and latest technology stack in order to achieve tailor-made deliverables for BearingPoint clients. The BearingPoint Business Services approach is based on collaboration, communication, knowledge sharing and support, therefore come join us and be part of the tech community inside our firm.
About our team and projects
Looking for a new colleague with strong initiative to join our team of developers. We work in a cross-cultural environment with team members from 6 European countries (Ireland, Romania, France, The Netherlands, Austria and Germany).
Our daily meetings are focused on the challenges we face regarding the product specifications and finding best technical solutions on how to approach them.
If you want to join us with a full-time, permanent engagement check out the details bellow, also, and apply so that we can meet you.
What we expect from you:
Experience working in a product team, collaborating with developers, designers, and project managers
Execute user interface designs from product requirements and UI specifications
Develop componentized UI architectures providing reusable UI elements
Apply design principles and user experience to implement high-fidelity mock-ups as well as interaction flows
Collaborate with back-end developers to develop a scalable, standardized and flexible UI architecture
Strong Problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Adapting interface for modern internet applications using the latest front-end technologies
Making complex technical and design decisions for Frontend projects
Working with the product team to ensure high application performance
Support project teams with expertise and mentoring for user interface design and testing
Perform code reviews
Your skills and preferred qualifications:
2-6 years of Frontend Development experience
Be proficient in Core JavaScript and ES6+
Real product experience with JavaScript/TypeScript frameworks such as Angular / ReactJS / Vue.js or other Frontend frameworks
HTML5, CSS3, SASS pre-processor
Writing cross-browser compatible code
Proven experience on working with REST API Design
Skill for writing reusable components
Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
Version Control – GIT
Ability to meet tight deadlines
Attention to detail
Excellent written and spoken English
Good analytical skills, critical thinking with a touch of creativity and a problem-solving mind-set
Ability and desire to work as part of a cross-cultural team
Open to learning new technical skills
Nice to have:
Microsoft Azure environment experience
Experience working in a cross-functional agile development environment
Equality Inclusion
BearingPoint is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce where each individual feels they belong. Fostering a work environment with a strong sense of community and where everyone can thrive is a core pillar of our business. We are focused on attracting and retaining the best people with the right skills and the desire to deliver excellent results, regardless of background. In return, we will provide a working environment in which everyone feels valued and has the opportunity to fulfil their potential, where their talents are fully utilised and company goals are met. We celebrate the strength that comes from our similarities and our differences through local initiatives which promote inclusion, outreach and respect.
What benefits are available to me:
BearingPoint offers hybrid working, excellent salary prospects and a best-in-class benefits package. For further information, see BearingPoint’s careers website.
If this sounds like the environment for you then we look forward to hearing from you!
About BearingPoint
BearingPoint is an independent management and technology consultancy with European roots and a global reach. The company operates in four units: Consulting, Solutions, Business Services, and Ventures. Consulting covers the advisory business; Solutions provides the tools for successful digital transformation, advanced analytics and regulatory requirements; Business Services provides managed services beyond SaaS; Ventures drives the financing and development of start-ups. BearingPoint’s clients include many of the world’s leading companies and organizations. The firm has a global consulting network with more than 10,000 people and supports clients in over 75 countries, engaging with them to achieve measurable and sustainable success.
BearingPoint is an equal opportunities employer.

The firm has a global consulting network with more than 10,000 people and supports clients in over 75 countries, engaging with them to achieve measurable and sustainable success.
BearingPoint is an equal opportunities employer.

Avanade ranked no.1 by Top Employer Institute in Ireland!

About us

Avanade is the world's leading digital innovator and believe in making genuine human impact in everything we do. This is through the power of our people and cutting-edge Microsoft Technology.

By joining Avanade's software engineering practice, you will have fantastic opportunity to operate at the forefront of technology, with access to best clients across the world, on challenging and exciting projects.

We are a diverse team, and we are proud of our culture that welcomes every individual. In our teams you will find talented and passionate technologists, with a humble, collaborative, and positive attitude.

If you are the type of person who thrives of constantly learning and challenging yourself with a genuine desire to do your best, then you could be successful here. We promise to invest in you and help give you the platform for continuous learning and development.

Frontend Developer

The Frontend Role Working closely with the UX and Visual Design team, this group has a shared interest in developing modern user interfaces that are compelling, performant and accessible.

As a client-facing Front-End Web Developer, you will have the opportunity to learn our client's business, their organization, systems, challenges and goals. You will partner directly with client(s) to define and clarify requirements, then work with your team to create accurate project and task estimates to deliver exceptional client results.

Responsibilities:
You will bring concepts and designs for user-facing web applications to life.

Deliver exceptional client results and project success.

Consistently develop and deliver high-quality, low-defect features onschedule

Configure, build, and test the application or technical architecture components.

Work with other developers, designers, and architects to make sure that the configuration and custom components meet application requirements and performance goals.

Develop proof-of-concepts and prototypes of easy-to-navigate user interfaces (UI) that consist of graphics, data visualizations, icons and colour schemes that are visually appealing, responsive, and accessible.

We are looking for developers who have:
Experience following and understanding good front-end practices

Experience with Typescript, Javascript, frameworks and libraries such as React.js, Redux, Angular, Vue, Angular 2+, Node.js and its ecosystem

Experience with the Microsoft Graph and Adaptive Cards

Experience with developing Teams Apps and Extensions is desirable

Deep understanding of html semantics, CSS (sass, less), box-model / flex-box

Practical knowledge about different testing approaches and tools (Unit testing, e2e testing, BDD, TDD)

Considerable experience leveraging Azure components as part of the Solution Design (e.g. Azure Functions, Bot Framework, etc.)

Good understanding about authentication and security

Worked in a scrum environment.

Passion for learning new technologies and staying up to date with the latest trends and modern development.

Experience being a great team player, who work collaborative, and brings a positive attitude

Strong verbal and written communication skills, and you can communicate information to technical and non-technical stakeholders alike.

Knowledge of DevOps and Backend engineering is a benefit.

Core Priority Tech Stack:
React

Angular 2+

JavaScript

Bootstrap

Razor

HTML 5

Blazor

TypeScript

Node.JS

CSS

Vue

Knockout

What we offer

This is a superb opportunity to be in a rewarding role, that offers ongoing training! Avanade pays for all Microsoft certifications and recognises your dedication by offering you a strong career path. You will have an exposure to work on complex but exciting projects, using variety of Microsoft stack technologies.

We are encouraging our employees to cross-train and develop their skills around different Microsoft technologies

You'll have ample opportunities for career growth and personal development, including ongoing professional technology training and management training.

Moreover:

Reward and Recognition scheme
Wide benefits package
Employee Share Purchase Plan
Avanade University - real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
Dedicated career manager to encourage your progression
Engaged and helpful co-workers genuinely interested in you

Company Description
We pledge "to prove IT can make a real difference to our customer's businesses". We work hard to ensure we understand what our customers need from their technology solutions and then we deliver.

We are an award-winning company who provide world class customer service; we think big and we hire great people. Version 1 are more than just another IT services company - we are leaders in implementing and supporting Oracle, Microsoft and AWS technologies.

Invest in us and we’ll invest in you; if you are driven, committed and up for a challenge, we want to meet you.

Job Description
Coding new developments and/or enhancements.
Design mobile applications, web applications, systems or processes.
Quality assures program specifications and code.
Create functional design documentation.
Adhere to code quality and unit testing standards
Identify and implement integration tests, automating tests where appropriate.
Investigate and manage complex Live Incidents.
Coordinate or escalate defects / problems.
Perform Root Cause Analysis.
Coordinate team or release activities.
Create and demonstrate prototypes/screen designs.
Supervise and coach junior resources.
Provide input to governance and status reports.

Qualifications

4+ years experience in programming mobile applications for IOS, Android and Hybrid.
Experience of building high-performing, scalable, enterprise-grade mobile applications.
Experience of Spring, JavaScript, Angular/AngularJS, Ionic, Typescript, SASS, Leaflet, Capacitor.
Experience of HTML, CSS, XML, & JSON.
Experience of developing webservices and Restful APIs.
Knowledge/experience of delivery methodologies, application development lifecycle, and delivery models.
Technical solution design skills to allow the analyst to determine the optimum solution using the correct blend of technologies to meet a set of defined requirements.
Additional Information
Before you apply, here are some of our benefits. We offer profit share, pension, private medical, flexible working policy and more. We offer incentives for accreditations and educational assistance for courses relevant to your role.
We offer employee recognition in the form of Excellence Awards and V1Ps which is awarded by your peers. Engagement is incredibly important with local engagement teams driving our engagement events! Company Description

Frontend Developer
Are you an ambitious frontend developer? Do you want to work in the Fin-Tech sector and create software for the world of finance and risk management? If you're looking for a collaborative environment where you can think outside the box, apply your own ideas, and bring value to a rapidly growing company while maintaining a healthy work/life balance, you will fit right in!
You will be an integral part of the team that works with the business to comprehend their needs, developing web applications and risk-related software packages to help the company expand and scale. Working alongside a senior developer you will be responsible for developing a client-facing web application and internal risk-related software packages.
What you’ll do
Improve and maintain the client facing web application.
Design and implement new features that enhance the user experience
Work with the development and risk team to implement client request and bug fixes.
Support future expansion and growth
Take a proactive approach to innovating and improving the web application.
What you’ll need
Bachelor's degree, preferably in computer science or design
Experience developing in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or other frontend programming languages. It is beneficial if you have used React.js but if not, you will be taught that in this role.
Python basic data manipulation ability or willingness to learn
An artistic mind with a willingness to understand and learn UX/UI and designs
Self-starter who can work on tasks with minimal supervision

Desirable skills
Familiarity of any backend programming language
Familiarity with design-related programs such as Figma, Balsamiq, and others.
Finance and risk management are areas of interest or experience.

What our client offers:
Collaborate and inclusive work environment where you can truly be yourself and have a tangible impact on the future growth of the business.
Competitive salary and performance bonus.
Hybrid working model – with 10 days a year to work from anywhere.
Private Health insurance
Educational support, fitness programs, Tax Saver scheme.
Team lunches and outings, pizza Fridays and snacks and drinks in the office. Frontend Developer

Company Description
TrustMeUp is a social impact platform that offers technological solutions for various fundraising challenges nonprofits have. It provides an innovative loyalty solution with commercial perks for donors and an all-in-one management platform for nonprofits. It also offers APIs for merchants to connect to donate by shopping and similar functionalities.

Job Description
We are looking for a Senior-Level Front-end Developer with a passion for building beautiful, mobile-friendly products.
You are going to work in an open-minded, outcome-oriented and helpful team. As a Front-end developer, you will need to work with Product Managers, UX/UI Designers as well as Back-end developers, so being a good communicator and collaborator is an important aspect for this role. You are also expected to attend pre-scheduled online meetings. You'll also take a part on estimating future tasks and be responsible to deliver on the defined time frame.
Responsibilities:
Implementing the features and user interfaces according to the design
Develop efficient and reusable front-end systems
Meeting acceptance criteria and keeping test coverage high
Collaborate with Product Designers, Product Managers, and Software Engineers
Working harmoniously in a team, respecting the team members

Qualifications
Good understanding of Javascript and the ecosystem
Proficiency in React
HTML/CSS experience, including emotion styled
Experience with Rest APIs
GraphQL experience
Experience with test tools Jest and Cypress experience is a
plus
Storybook experience
Knowledge of Amazon Web Services hosting
Understanding of startup-based demands such as presentations, reviews, and pivots.
Proficient in English
Additional Information
We are looking for a motivated, curious, creative person, with good analysis and synthesis skills, priority management, multitasking skills, good interpersonal and teamwork skills, aptitude for problem solving and passion for the digital world and technological innovation.
We offer a continuous professional growth program within an innovative structure and remuneration of certain interest for the most qualified candidates. We are open to evaluate full-time and contract positions.
The research is aimed at people of both genders.
When submitting please indicate the authorization for the processing of personal data pursuant to EU GDPR rules. Company Description

It provides an innovative loyalty solution with commercial perks for donors and an all-in-one management platform for nonprofits. It also offers APIs for merchants to connect to donate by shopping and similar functionalities.

TrustMeUp is a social impact platform that offers technological solutions for various fundraising challenges nonprofits have. It provides an innovative loyalty solution with commercial perks for donors and an all-in-one management platform for nonprofits. It also offers APIs for merchants to connect to donate by shopping and similar functionalities. Job Description
We are looking for a Senior-Level Front-end Developer with a passion for building beautiful, mobile-friendly products.
You are going to work in an open-minded, outcome-oriented and helpful team. As a Front-end developer, you will need to work with Product Managers, UX/UI Designers as well as Back-end developers, so being a good communicator and collaborator is an important aspect for this role. You are also expected to attend pre-scheduled online meetings. You'll also take a part on estimating future tasks and be responsible to deliver on the defined time frame.

Front-End Software EngineerAs a front-end engineer, you will be responsible for helping a team of developers engineer several interconnected front-end web applications, as well as native mobile applications, using a combination of ReactJS, ReactNative, native iOS and native Android.The applications in question will revolve around several different feature-sets for our diverse types of users, which include:An app to manage their organizational hierarchy (users, roles, permission sets, resources, departments, etc.) with their own robust, customizable roles.An app for users to manage the IoT devices at many distributed locations across the globe.An app for viewing and analyzing the collected data and metrics from IoT devices as well as company operations logs.Various additional applications as our product offerings grow.You will work most closely with the product owner, UX engineer and software development team, as well as with the firmware developers and sales engineers of our IoT products, in order to understand the products and workflows we offer to our clients so that you can help engineer an efficient and clean user experience for our users.A successful candidate will have a curious, inventive, and flexible mind; will have an eye and a memory for detail; and will have the communication and inter-personal skills to communicate with developers and business stakeholders accurately and thoroughly, while maintaining friendly and professional relationships.Duties and ResponsibilitiesHelp develop and maintain multiple front-end applications across several different product offeringsParticipate in design discussions with the UX Engineer and the rest of the software team and help propose alternative UI when you feel any UI being proposed may interfere with the performance or business logic of the back-end services.Not hesitate to seek clarification from, or provide feedback to, developers and other team members using any appropriate communication channels.Required Skills and AbilitiesReactJS and/or ReactNativeCSS, SCSS, SassHTML, JavascriptJestGit and GithubExperience building for accessibilityExperience building for multiple languages and localesAn understanding of responsive design and mobile-first design for web applicationsOptional Skills and Abilities that will helpExperience with collecting user analyticsSome knowledge of popular design paradigms or guidelines, such as Material Design.Experience building Desktop or Electron appsExperience building native iOS apps using Swift or Objective-CExperience building native Android apps using JavaMTI is an Equal OpportunityEmployer Mobile Technologies, INC. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Mobile Technologies, Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: €57,000.00-€63,000.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftCOVID-19 considerations:We are following all health and safety guidelines with respect to Covid-19. Software Quality EngineerWe are looking for an experienced detail-oriented Software Quality Engineer to join our expanding product development team. If you want to grow your career in a dynamic and exciting growth market and be a key player in rolling out new software releases of revolutionary P2P products, this is the right opportunity for you.About SoftCo: SoftCo are a fast growing global Procure-to-Pay and Compliance technology company disrupting the FinTech market. We will double in size over the next 2 years and are looking for smart, proactive and fun people to be part of our exciting journey. Our Smart Automation technology is transforming how companies manage their Procure-to-Pay processes, reducing costs and fighting fraud. Our cloud-based solutions use the latest emerging AI and Robotics technologies to do this for our customers.We operate from offices in the US, Finland, UK and are head quartered in Ireland. We are proud that all our projects are successful, and that our market-leading technology delivers our customers unrivalled levels of automation and the greatest savings. We have over a million users worldwide including PwC, Volkswagen, Primark, Sunny Delight and the 76 departments of the Finnish Government. We are seriously certified with ISO27001, Microsoft Gold Partner, all types of SOC and we are an AWS Advanced Technology Partner.Software Quality Engineer –Your role: We are looking for an experienced detail-oriented Software Quality Engineer to join our expanding product development team in Dublin. If you want to grow your career in a dynamic and exciting growth market and be a key player in rolling out new software releases of revolutionary P2P products, this is the right opportunity for you. As a Quality Engineer you will:Deliver excellent quality on all product development releases.Work within an agile environment and perform testing, maintain the test cases, analyze, and communicate test results efficiently and comprehensively to the team.Work within a team to build innovative approaches to ensure the best-in-class quality.Liaise with developers and other departments as required on items relating to product quality and report regularly on project progress during regular stand-ups.Ensure compliance with ISO 27001 and other quality and compliance standards.Your profile: Degree qualification, or proven background in Computer Science and/or Software Testing.Formal QA training / certifications such as ISTQB would be advantageous.Ability to work on your own and as part of a team.Good understanding of test approaches like integration testing, functional testing, regression, performance, automated & manual testing.Experience in manual testing of web applications, test case planning and bug reporting. Knowledge of test management tools (e.g., TFS (Team Foundation Server) Quality Center, QA Complete etc.) and experience of working as a member in agile team (Scrum) would be advantageous.Ability to challenge both peers and managers to ensure quality is always a priority.Strong workload management skills, an eye for detail and a systematic approach. Focused on timely results with a high degree of accountability and responsibility.Self-motivated and willing to question, learn and develop.Fluent in English, eligible to work in Ireland with good communication skills.What we can offer you: This is an opportunity to expand your knowledge, develop your career and work with state-of-the-art technology in a rapidly growing sector. SoftCo has a flexible remote working policy enabling you to choose what works for you. We encourage our team to be ambitious and in SoftCo there is a culture of progression. We support your development by investing in training and partnering with leading learning platforms and providers such as Pluralsight amongst others. Uniquely, our structure means you work directly with the most senior leaders in the business, who see your potential.A competitive remuneration package is on offer and our benefits package includes membership of our on-site gym, company paid health insurance, life assurance, pension, bonus package, long service incentive awards and a staff referral scheme. Our customers are all over the world, so travel is an option and if working for one of the most innovative technology companies is your thing, then look no further. SoftCo is an equal opportunities employer. Learn more about us and see examples of how some of our team have developed at softco.com/about-us/careers/.ApplicationsPlease send a cover letter and your CV to careers@softco.com.Job Type: Full-time Software Quality EngineerWe are looking for an experienced detail-oriented Software Quality Engineer to join our expanding product development team. Company Description
“Version 1 is celebrating 25 years in the IT industry this year and we continue to be trusted by global brands to deliver IT solutions that drive customer success.
Version 1 is not just a Microsoft Gold Partner, an AWS Premier Consulting Partner and an Oracle Platform Partner; we are also an award-winning employer and our employees are at the heart of Version 1. We invest in a strong culture of wellness through programs that help our employees create their journey toward optimal wellbeing. This framework is based on the ‘Strength in Balance‘ theme and this seen again in our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging Team motto “Bring Your Difference“.”

Job Description
We are looking for Mid level Java Developers who will be working with a team of engineers and testers to create solutions and deliver both mobile and web applications to our clients. The ideal candidate is someone who has a track record of high-quality delivery, combined with a keen appetite for all aspects of software development. You should be hands on, able to contribute individually and should have experience of working in a fast pace dynamic environment.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Implement solutions as per technical design and participate in design activities as required
Planning and estimation of development tasks as part of the SCRUM team and strive for accuracy while meeting deadlines
Participate in the full development lifecycle of new functionality and enhancements on greenfield and existing applications
Commitment to producing high quality, highly performant and robust software within agreed time estimates and to agreed quality standards
Participate in changes, and continuous improvements to existing software development, testing and deployment processes
Ability to work hands on in a fast-paced, agile work environment supporting your colleagues as required
Ability to work in a team and collaborate with multiple business and technical teams.

Qualifications

3-5 years’ experience in software development (Java), ideally at least 2+ years of which was working with Java as the principal technology used with related degree qualification (comp sci, engineering, etc).
Experience upgrading Java Spring applications/services from older Java versions (6+) to newer Java versions (11+)
Ability to take legacy Java Spring services and rewrite/refactor onto the latest Java Spring stack
Experience working with Oracle WebLogic (advantage), implementing CI/CD pipelines and working in a cross-functional Scrum team in an agile environment
Hands-on experience with Azure technologies is an advantage
Constantly improve the products, through feedback and input on the product pipeline and roadmap
Experience building cloud-native or serverless applications an advantage
Additional Information
Before you apply, here are some of our benefits. We offer profit share, pension, private healthcare cover, flexible working policy and more. We offer incentives for accreditations and educational assistance for courses relevant to your role.
We offer employee recognition in the form of Excellence Awards and V1Ps which is awarded by your peers. Engagement is incredibly important with local engagement teams driving our engagement events!
Anthony Cronin,
Version 1 Talent Acquisition Team
Tel: +353 1 901 9038

Senior Front-end Developer - React, Dublin (Remote)
Optum, the fast-growing part of UnitedHealth Group, is a leading information and technology-enabled health services business. Our teams are dedicated to modernizing the health care system and improving the lives of people and communities.
Serving virtually every dimension of the health system, we work with a diverse set of clients across 150 countries – from those who diagnose and treat patients to those who pay for care, deliver health services, and those who supply the cures. Optum maintains operations across North America, South America, Europe, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. Our innovative partnerships provide technology and tools that enable unprecedented collaboration and efficiency. As a result, we can tap into valuable health care data to uncover insights and develop strategies for better care at lower costs.
About the role:
We are looking for an Experienced UI developer with a proven track record of delivering UI requirements into production to lead the design, implementation and delivery of new UI features on the Emisar Analytics Gateway product. You will work alongside the UX and Product team to design new UI components for the product. You will work as part of the existing agile development team to deliver these features and integrate them with the backend dependencies. Join us! There's never been a better time to do your life's best work℠
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead the design, implementation and delivery of new UI features on the Emisar Analytics Gateway product
Work alongside the UX and Product team to design new UI components for the product
Become part of an existing Agile development team
Delivering and integrating features with the backend dependencies
You will be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role, as well as providing development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Strong demonstrable experience using front end development and production releases
TypeScript experience
Experience using React, React Hooks, Context API and Mobile responsive
Good communication skills across external stakeholders
Redux, Redux-Saga, Redux-Toolkit experience
Ability to work a portion of monthly work hours from our Dublin or Letterkenny office is required
Assets:
Cloud experience (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience using Jenkins
Docker experience
Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.
All telecommuters will be required to adhere to the UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

COMPANY OVERVIEW
Our Mission is to make compliance for Banks and FinTechs easier by providing innovative AML compliance software, protecting Banks & FinTechs against $Multi-Billion fines by changing the way that AML Transactions Monitoring is done.
JOB OVERVIEW
We are looking for a front-end developer to join our development team. In this role you will work closely with our development and product team to develop, modify our web-based application and user interfaces across all channels. We want someone who is motivated by emerging technologies and has a passion to drive digital transformation. A real desire to work in a collaborative and fast-paced retail environment is essential.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Should be able to deliver best-in-class user interfaces for our web-based application.
Collaborate with our UX and Backend Engineering team to ensure our user experience is enhanced and bringing a balance between functional and aesthetic design.

Developing high quality, testable and performance software using agile practices.
Driving best technology and software development practices in the team with passion and enthusiasm.
Assisting analysts and business stakeholders in shaping, estimating, and planning new requirements.
Participating in regular showcases of new work to the product owners and business stakeholders.
Striving for continuous improvement within the team.


REQUIREMENTS


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
4+ years of solid experience.
Excellent communication and written skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
Experience with responsive and adaptive design.
Excellent organisation and time management skills.
Knowledge of the security aspect of web applications is important.
Knowledge of the main web standards and on-page optimisation is important.
Good problem solving skills and ability to collaborate across teams.


TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS

Proven experience working in RESTful APIs.
Solid experience in using GIT.
Required web development skills, for example., HTML 5, CSS 3, JavaScript.
Good knowledge of Angular UI Bootstrap and SASS, fusion charts, D3.js, React.
Proven experience working in JavaScript and asynchronous functions.
Being at ease on Linus is required.
graph learning would be a great add on.
Proven work experience with web crawlers and natural language processing.
Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: D3.js.


BENEFITS

Competitive salary
Laptop of your choice
Monthly social events and team off sites
Free barista coffee, snacks, fruits & a vibrant community.
Regular networking events, mentoring events and conferences.
Freedom to explore the latest tools and technologies.
Company knowledge-sharing activities. COMPANY OVERVIEW

GET TO KNOW US

At Brown Thomas Arnotts, we exist to imagine and create a sustainable future for our People, Customers and Communities. Our Values, Do the Right Thing, Go Above and Beyond and Drive Creativity and Innovation remain at the heart of everything we do. We are Reinventing Retail and the way we work to enable our teams to be more agile, flexible and responsive to our customer’s needs.

KNOW THE ROLE

Our Digital Content Team is recruiting for a Senior Web Designer. This role represents a great opportunity to work in a fast paced & rewarding creative environment. The successful candidate will lead innovative design solutions and supervise other Designers reporting to the Design Lead. They will be responsible for creating elevated concepts, wireframes, final builds and leading the team's transition to a headless CMS (Adobe Experience Manager).
This is a full-time, permanent position.

Applications without a portfolio or similar included will not be considered

Leading the development of ideas and delivering new content formats for site and email
Mentoring & supervising talented designers
Managing Content projects
Delivering pixel perfect frontend graphics, from concept to delivery
Design, build and deployment of bespoke web pages & emails
Working to ensure a visually memorable and exciting brand experiences


KNOW WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Passionate about all things design.
A strong eye for detail, composition & typography.
Someone who is adaptable to changing priorities and enjoys working in a fast paced, dynamic environment.
Will become a brand guardian by reviewing designs for consistency and adherence to the design system whilst continously evolving the brand.
Comfortable working in a fast paced, dynamic environment.
A problem solver, capable of resolving complex issues.
Highly organised and able to deliver to tight deadlines.

Qualifications

Proficiency in HTML, CSS, Javascript, Python
Demonstrable web design skills with an excellent portfolio.
Experienced with industry standard design packages such as Adobe Creative Cloud, with particular focus on Photoshop, Illustrator, XD.
Fluent in spoken and written English

Bonus skills

Experience with Javascript, Python
Previous management experience
Experience with Adobe Experience Manager and Adobe Target
Well versed in UX principles.
Knowledgeable of the latest mobile/desktop design patterns, interaction design, and innovative coding techniques.
Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce Commerce Cloud.


KNOW WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

We believe that every team member should have the opportunity to a meaningful career that enhances professional and personal development. That is why; we foster a culture of belonging and inclusiveness, one that provides learning and purpose. We show respect for individual needs and circumstances and we enable our people to work in a way that best suits their unique lifestyles and their roles. We place trust in our teams to do the right thing for Brown Thomas Arnotts and keep our customers and team at the heart of our decision-making.
Competitive Salary
Contributory Pension Scheme
Competitive annual leave entitlement
Team Member discount across the world’s most iconic brands
Recognition Days for Volunteering & Wellbeing
Wellbeing Initiatives
Extensive Learning & Development Offerings
Leading Talent Programmes
Flexible Working Model
Additional Benefits
KNOW HOW WE WORK

We Drive Creativity and Innovation: Creativity runs through our veins and fuels everything we do. We are an enterprising team that thinks outside the box to bring new ideas to life and to create unrivalled experiences designed for our customers and our world. Fostering a culture of innovation, we keep ahead of the rest while growing sustainably.

We Go Above and Beyond: As agents of change within our industry we set the standard, always leading, never imitating. We love to go where others haven't and thrive on sharing our knowledge and expertise. We work to surpass expectations, inspiring everyone who comes in to contact with our brands.

We Do the Right Thing: We respect our world and everyone we interact with. Acting with decency, honesty and transparency, we strive to ensure that everything we contemplate or do, contributes to a sustainable future. Software Developer


Kneat enables regulated organizations to move from paper-based validation to intelligent, digitized, paperless solutions. And we do it through the ongoing development of a powerful, purpose-built software platform. In 2014, after eight years of intensive software development, we launched Kneat Gx—the world’s most advanced validation software to help revolutionize the speed, precision, transparency, and intelligence of validation in the Life Sciences sector. Our solution is now used by some of the world’s leading Life Sciences companies.
What we’re looking for
As Kneat continues to expand, we are looking for an enthusiastic Software Developer to join our R&D department.
Position overview
Reporting to our Software Development Manager, the Software Developer will help Kneat grow its market leading technology by contributing to the continuous growth and improvement of our software.
The successful candidate will use their proven technical skills to drive enhancements to our product suite. We are seeking an enthusiastic and team-oriented self-starter who can use the latest tools and technologies to create real world solutions to complex user problems, while growing their professional full stack experience in a fast-paced agile environment. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!
Responsibilities

Build and improve new features and product areas that will support our growing customer base.
Work as part of an Agile team from initial ideas, designing, and prototyping through to final delivery.
Be comfortable with engaging with new technologies and leveraging cloud-based services to optimize what you deliver.
Be happy to bring new ideas to the table and work with stakeholders and other technical experts across teams to find solutions.
Have a passion for continuous improvement and maintaining high coding standards.
Take ownership of your work through to customer deployment.
Be happy dealing with customers and stakeholders to use their feedback to improve our product and processes.


Minimum qualifications

Have 3 years + of programming experience with commercial software.
Experience working on many aspects of the web development stack—front-end, back-end, data, and code deployment (you may not be an expert in all areas)!
Solid Net Core/JavaScript or equivalent experience in other OOP languages, along with SQL knowledge.
Good knowledge and experience creating REST APIs.
Ability to write high quality, secure, and performant code as part of a team.
Good understanding of CI/CD and pipelines.


Nice to haves

Comfortable working with containers.
Have worked with AWS or similar cloud-based services.
Experience with Behavior Driven Development.
Experience with React 16+ and Node.JS.


What we offer you
At Kneat, we truly value ideas and collaboration so we’ve created an environment that builds, protects, and celebrates teamwork. Our strong culture is central to our continued success.
We offer programs and rewards that one would expect from a highly successful and growing technology company.

A fantastic culture, team, and energy.
Competitive compensation.
Comprehensive benefits package.
Flexible work arrangements.
Training and professional development.


Kneat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status.


Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs to perform these essential functions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to complete this application form, please contact us at +353 (0)612 038 26 (Ext 2004) or email us at hr@kneat.com for assistance. Boostlingo is a fun, fast-growing language software and technology company focused on defining and developing the next generation of interpretation technology solutions. We are all about creating technology that connects people across the globe and breaking down communication barriers. We deliver multilingual communication access via interpretation delivery and interpretation management software applications.At Boostlingo, our vision is to provide technologies that provide seamless access to language support services. Boostlingo serves clients in a variety of markets with a focus on Health Care, Legal, Education and Financial Services. Boostlingo’s product and its on-demand network of professional interpreters allows customers to provide over-the-phone and video-remote interpretations to their clients.Boostlingo is looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our talented engineering team in Ireland, located at the Kells Enterprise and Technology Center. You will work closely with engineering, QA, DevOps and product teams to help define and improve how we build, test and ship our products. You must be a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, agile environment, and must be able to prioritize, multi-task and manage your workload while providing guidance to other team members.As a senior member of the engineering team you will be expected to lead development projects from requirements review through implementation and testing and to ensure that high quality features and functionality are delivered to production systems.This is an exciting opportunity for a senior engineer to be a core contributor on a cutting edge SaaS platform with web and native mobile components using advanced technologies such as telephony and video communication for real time interactions between users. Your role will be critical in ensuring that the engineering team delivers quality code that meets the needs of end users. You will help define the engineering culture that develops mission critical SaaS software in a secure and iterative fashion meeting the highest quality standards.What you will do:Participate in the product development process of SaaS applicationsDesign and develop scalable, secure and reusable softwareWork independently, meet deadlines, adapt to shifting priorities, and manage multiple projects at a timeLead, collaborate, mentor and manage a small team of developers (onshore/offshore)Be a voice of engineering in reviewing feature requirements and communicating implementation approaches with the product and engineering teamReview code and promote/enforce clean coding principles and design patternsAssist with deployments and work with DevOps to troubleshoot operational issues.Monitor application metrics to ensure the expected results are met with continual user growthContribute to creating an engineering culture that supports innovation and creativity while delivering high quality products with predictability and reliability and one that fosters ownership and teamwork over individualism.*What we are looking for:7+ years of hands-on experience in design, architecture, and development activities using Java/Groovy, MySQL, JavaScript, NodeJS React, Angular, JavaScript, TypeScriptFluent in the Java tech stack (Java, Linux, Apache, MySQL (RDS)) or other high-level language (e.g., C#, .NET, C++), and not afraid to take on other new technologiesExperience with Service Oriented Architecture and MicroservicesExperience in creating and using scalable and distributed RESTful Web APIsExperience in developing modern web sites, dashboards and visualizationsExperienced with tuning application performance, as well as writing unit and integration automated testsExperienced in building CI/CD pipelinesProficient at using appropriate security, testing, documentation, and/or monitoring best practicesExcellent presentation, verbal and written communication skillsAbility to communicate both technical and non-technical aspects in a clear and effective mannerA Startup employee mindsetNice to have:Direct experience with Twilio in one or more of the following Junior Software Engineer
Dublin, Ireland
LexisNexis® Risk Solutions Group is looking to recruit a talented programmer and technology enthusiast to join our fast-growing Dublin Team. You will be responsible for implementing, and delivering scalable and robust enterprise software solutions. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter who truly enjoys learning and embracing scale and the unknown, can handle several competing priorities. Above all, we seek an eagerness to learn new things while staying abreast of emerging industry trends and platforms.
Qualities we are looking for: Enthusiastic about the sheer joy of writing (and deleting!) code. Comfortable challenging the status quo. Open to learning new technologies and new problem domains. Eager to review code and able to communicate clearly and efficiently. Knowledge of languages from the .NET family or other enterprise-grade languages. And genuine enthusiasm for experimenting with technology and software.
Bonus points for: Active and recent open-source contributions, documented knowledge sharing (an active blog, recent articles, SO activity). Familiarity with functional programming - knowledge of functional languages like Haskell, F#, Scala, Erlang. Experience in any tier of software development, knowledge of containers and container hosting (ECS/K8S, etc.) is most welcome.
Responsibilities: Help building next-generation systems infrastructure to help LNRS scale and support its growth. Advocate for continuous improvement of our software development process. Make work easier by shortening feedback loops and leveraging detailed telemetry. Application support including problem research, analysis, and resolution.
What we do
Cloud
Linux
Containers
Scale
Web APIs
Distributed systems: stateful and stateless
.NET: C# and F#
Actors
Performance
Functional programming
Testing in production
Many releases per day
Short iterations and feedback loops
Small blast radius
Dark environments
Markdown, PUML, Mermaid
Pair programming
Open Source
We’re a superb company to work for, with great people, world class technology, market leading products, a culture of innovation and collaboration, and superb career prospects.
At LexisNexis Risk Solutions, we believe in the power of data and advanced analytics for better risk management. With over 40 years of expertise, we are the trusted data analytics provider for organizations seeking actionable insights to manage risks and improve results while upholding the highest standards for security and privacy. Headquartered in metro Atlanta, LexisNexis Risk Solutions serves customers in more than 100 countries and is part of FTS 100, RELX Group plc, a world-leading provider of information and analytics for professional and business customers across industries.
LexisNexis is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications regardless of sex, marital status, ethnic origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation or age.
RELX is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact accommodations@relx.com or if you are based in the US you may also contact us on 1.855.833.5120..

Job Title: Software Developer (Grad)

Location: Galway (Ireland)
Salary: Competitive
Starting Date: 2022 (Flexible)
What We’re Looking For:

At SOTI, our people are our most important resource. We’re looking for focused ambitious individuals to take part in a diverse innovative global team as a Software Developer within our Research & Development Hub in Galway, Ireland. If you’re passionate about the Technology industry, enjoy learning new technologies while aligning it to creating real business solutions we want to hear from you.
SOTI is looking for passionate innovative postgraduates or recent graduates who have successfully completed their studies within a computer science or related technical field (within academia or home-based study) to take part in great opportunity to kick start your career within Software Engineering.
As a successful candidate, you’ll get the chance to work with leading edge technologies and take on complex and interesting projects as part of fast-paced, highly collaborative and agile teams. You are an experienced Software Developer who specializes in .NET solution and is excited to learn from talented, fun-loving developers breaking down complex problems into simple solutions. You have the passion for software architecture and design and enjoy building robust scalable applications in a cross-platform environment. A self-starter who can co-ordinate with a team yet work independently towards a common goal.
What You’ll Do:
Develop innovative solutions to tackle big industry problems
Write well designed, scalable, reliable, testable and reusable code by using best software development practices, clean code and solid principles
Provide technical guidance on the research and development of new products and services
Contribute towards the entire development lifecycle of analysis, design, implementation and test
Detect, report, investigate, and fix product defects
Automation, including writing unit and integration tests
Optimize and apply best practices
Maintain high standards of quality for code, technical documentation, and deliverables
Provide leadership on implementation of web solutions in C# and .NET
Collaborate on projects with an all-star team comprised of varying skillsets through code reviews and design discussions
Participate in brainstorming and idea generation activities
Stay up to date with advanced technologies in order to be able to provide the best solutions for new projects
What’s in it for you?
The People - From our humble origins in our founder’s basement to our industry-leading position today, SOTI has worked hard to foster a company culture that we can all believe in. A culture that emphasizes personal growth, continuous innovation and fun.
The Growth - Our environment fosters new ideas, fresh perspectives, and the ability to take them over the finish line. At SOTI we have a fast-paced environment with a global reach that encourages you to make your mark and be part of something big!
The Technology - You’ll get the chance to work with leading-edge technologies and take on complex and interesting projects, as part of highly collaborative and agile teams. You will work alongside SOTI’s partners including some leading tech giants that will keep you on the cusp of emerging technologies.
Qualifications
A minimum of 1 year of related experience working in software development environments where you are building front-end and back-end components of Web applications
Exposure to developing with C# .NET programming language
Good understanding of software design patterns
Good understanding of data modelling and storage with well-known relational database (preferably SQL)
Demonstrable versatility in multiple front-end and back-end technologies such as JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, AngularJS, NodeJS, REST APIs, JSON, WCF, Web API, Unity, LINQ
Experience (or strong interest) in agile methods such as Scrum/XP, Behaviour Driven Development, and Continuous Delivery
What SOTI expects from you in this role!!!!!
At SOTI we pride ourselves on being innovative forward thinkers and not adhering to the norm, we have some core strengths listed below that will set you up for success within this role.
Commercial Awareness – It’s important to stay up to date with the business and industry with technologies, keeping aware of the latest industry news. The more you understand about how we operate as a business the easier it will be to understand the significance of your role.
Technical – Continuous passion for technology, and new programing languages plus frameworks, such as C#. Python, Java, JavaScript, C, Linux, and android studios/core/for fun and windows. Always open to learning new technologies, sharing ideas and relative information gained internally and externally which may benefit your team.
Individual – Being confident having self-motivation taking pride in the work you do while always striving to do better as an individual. Continuing to learn on your own, show your passion for programming.
Behaviour – Having respect for all teams within the business and conducting yourself in a professional manner always. Being able to use your initiative when required while also being an analytical thinker.
Collaboration & Communication – Attention to detail is vital being able to communicate affectively with all colleagues, as SOTI is a cross functional team. So, we expect you to be able to communicate at all levels whether in a technical sense or non-technical. Stand out we encourage collaboration within the business it’s important to innovate and gain perspectives from various internal teams.
Interpersonal – High energy levels leading from the front when needed being able to be a good team player but also just as affective on your own as a programmer.
Who We Are?
SOTI is the world's most trusted provider of enterprise mobility management (EMM) solutions, with over 17,000 enterprise customers and millions of devices managed worldwide. SOTI's portfolio of solutions and services provides the tools organizations need to truly mobilize their operations and optimize their mobility investments. Our award-winning solution, SOTI MobiControl, allows enterprises to enable, optimize and secure their mobile workforce across all platforms to support corporate-liable and Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) policies.
SOTI works closely with top mobile device manufacturers such as: Samsung, Microsoft, Intermec, Honeywell, RIM, Motorola, Aruba, Bluebird, Panasonic, ZTE, LG, etc. SOTI’s world-class remote technology is second to none & is licensed by top mobile device hardware & software brands. We are passionate about producing innovative solutions that deliver results and solve real customer needs
From our humble origins in the founder’s basement, to our industry leading position today, SOTI has worked hard to foster a company culture that we can all believe in. A culture that emphasizes personal growth, continuous innovation and tons of fun.
If you want to bring your ideas to life, apply at SOTI today.

In the absence of a signed Services Agreement with agency/recruiter, SOTI will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Frontend Engineer, Crypto & Blockchain
CipherTrace, a Mastercard company, is a rapidly growing leader in cryptocurrency intelligence and compliance. Our team has introduced novel solutions to challenges including sanctions compliance for DeFi and the Crypto Travel Rule. Our mission is to grow the blockchain economy by making crypto safe for users and trusted by governments. CipherTrace operates on a global scale to assist banks, cryptocurrency exchanges, law enforcement agencies, regulators, VASPs, and businesses in preventing fraud, human trafficking, money laundering, and other illicit activity where cryptocurrency is involved.

The ideal candidate should be a passionate, self-motivated, team player with experience working in a quickly evolving environment and who has a willingness to work and learn in a collaborative organization.

Responsibilities
Build the next generation cryptocurrency tools, law enforcement tools, and DeFi platforms.Build middleware services to interface the UI to the Back End infrastructure.Write Angular.js to display Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrencies cross-platform.Debug and perform quality testing on the Blockchain cryptocurrency data user interface.Design reactive API software for real-time cryptocurrency displays.Write software in JavaScript to allow users to interactively investigate wallets and addresses of multiple cryptocurrencies.Co-design software APIs with back-end developers to access cryptocurrency feeds.Develop middleware modules to visualize cryptocurrency transactions.
Requirements
8+ years of experience building enterprise JavaScript web applications.
JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, styled components, and frameworks like Angular, React, Node.js.
SQL/noSQL, Cassandra, PostgreSQL, MySQL, BigQuery, Elasticsearch, GraphQL.Restful APIs, Kafka, and microservices.Data visualization app development and concepts.Blockchain technologies, DeFi, law enforcement software, or cryptocurrencies.
Nice to Have
Experience with data visualization libraries like D3.js.Strong English communication skills (both spoken and written).
COVID-19 Considerations
We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together. In many locations, which may change over time, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice.
In the US, Mastercard is a government contractor, which may legally require most Mastercard employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard.
Corporate Security Responsibility
All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines. Our Purpose

We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.  Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Frontend Engineer, Crypto & Blockchain
CipherTrace, a Mastercard company, is a rapidly growing leader in cryptocurrency intelligence and compliance. Our team has introduced novel solutions to challenges including sanctions compliance for DeFi and the Crypto Travel Rule. Our mission is to grow the blockchain economy by making crypto safe for users and trusted by governments. CipherTrace operates on a global scale to assist banks, cryptocurrency exchanges, law enforcement agencies, regulators, VASPs, and businesses in preventing fraud, human trafficking, money laundering, and other illicit activity where cryptocurrency is involved.

The ideal candidate should be a passionate, self-motivated, team player with experience working in a quickly evolving environment and who has a willingness to work and learn in a collaborative organization.

Responsibilities
Build the next generation cryptocurrency tools, law enforcement tools, and DeFi platforms.Build middleware services to interface the UI to the Back End infrastructure.Write Angular.js to display Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrencies cross-platform.Debug and perform quality testing on the Blockchain cryptocurrency data user interface.Design reactive API software for real-time cryptocurrency displays.Write software in JavaScript to allow users to interactively investigate wallets and addresses of multiple cryptocurrencies.Co-design software APIs with back-end developers to access cryptocurrency feeds.Develop middleware modules to visualize cryptocurrency transactions.
Requirements
8+ years of experience building enterprise JavaScript web applications.
JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, styled components, and frameworks like Angular, React, Node.js.
SQL/noSQL, Cassandra, PostgreSQL, MySQL, BigQuery, Elasticsearch, GraphQL.Restful APIs, Kafka, and microservices.Data visualization app development and concepts.Blockchain technologies, DeFi, law enforcement software, or cryptocurrencies.
Nice to Have
Experience with data visualization libraries like D3.js.Strong English communication skills (both spoken and written).
COVID-19 Considerations
We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together. In many locations, which may change over time, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice.
In the US, Mastercard is a government contractor, which may legally require most Mastercard employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard.

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines. Our Purpose
