Overview:

Front End Web Developer is a key role on our team responsible for feature development and maintenance of our team's mission-critical, enterprise-scale business systems. This role primarily concerns front-end web development, interactive design and contribution to our code base, tools and processes that drive the team's workflow. The Front End Web Developer will function as a member of the Development Team, and will collaborate with other team members to complete projects while improving team culture. We highly value great design skills coupled with problem solving and elegant code writing ability.
Qualifications:
BSc in Computer Science or comparable training in data structures, object oriented programming, application performance analysis and user interface design
UI experience:
ReactJS excellent
JQuery
Javascript
CSS, SASS excellent
HTML5
JSP
JAVA:
Java SE 1.8 and upper
JEE 8
OOP fundamentals
Spring Framework (MVC, bean, SpringBoot: desirable)
IoC and AOP(desirable)
Hibernate
WEB Servers:
JBoss
Tomcat

Responsibilities:
To analyse market requirements and produce information architecture, wire-frames, user flows, and finalgraphic elements.
Taking input from multiple sources and synthesize it into coherent wireframes.
Implementing UI designs using the latest web and JavaScript and front-end technologies
Development of new requirements and on-going maintenance of current system.
Leading design and development of front-end functionality.
Design and develop client-server modules and components across the full JEE stack.
Maintain a high level of code integrity by writing clean and testable code
Must be able to function as a leader as well as a contributor.
Ability to work independently and cross-functionally.
Excellent listening and communication skills. Overview:

QA Engineer
PICO is expanding its test engineering team which is responsible for ensuring the quality of its high performance, real-time analysis products, utilizing the latest software and hardware technologies. This team delivers innovative, automated testing solutions to verify the accuracy, performance, functionality, stress, resilience and use case validation of the company’s products.

Working from our Dublin office you will be working in a team that are passionate about quality. Working in our agile team you will be responsible for designing comprehensive functional testing and system testing strategies along with playing a key role in automating developed tests, using in-house automation test framework, to ensure our industry leading product is high quality.
The Role

The successful applicant will have 4+ years of test engineering experience, preferably dealing with enterprise products based on Linux, and have a good working knowledge of network technologies and scripting languages.
Responsibilities

Ensuring the quality of industry leading financial and enterprise core product features
Working within an agile software development lifecycle to test new product features
Designing functional and system test strategies using QA best practices
Using scripting and programming skills to automate tests using python, Jenkins


Requirements

BSc. in Computer Science or related discipline
3+ years relevant industry experience
Ease with Linux/Unix operating systems
Strong scripting/ programming skills using Python or similar
Good working knowledge of Jenkins and using/configuring the same for automation
Good knowledge of functional and system testing, such as performance, best practices
Experience in manual and automated testing on backend and web applications
Excellent problem-solving, debugging and troubleshooting skills
Excellent verbal and written English-language communication skills


Desirable

Good working knowledge of IP networking protocols and systems
Industry certifications such as CCNA and CCNP are highly desirable
Industry certifications in virtualization & cloud technologies such as VMWare, AWS highly desirable
Experience in testing HW systems such as servers and associated components QA Engineer

At Deloitte, we deliver the solutions and insights our clients need to address their most complex business challenges. As the world’s largest global professional services and consulting network, Deloitte Ireland has nearly 3,000 people providing audit & assurance, tax, consulting, and corporate finance services to public and private clients spanning multiple industries.
Deloitte’s Consulting Practice is one of the world's leading Management Consulting firms for executable Strategy, Operations, Technology, and Human Capital Advisory services. The consulting practice is built around integrated core capabilities - people, process, technology and industry expertise - the capabilities needed to help clients to tackle their most complex challenges.
At Deloitte, we trust our people to make the right choices around how, where and when they work. Our empowered hybrid way of working allows you to be collaborative, learn from colleagues, share your experiences, build the relationships that will fuel your career and work on individual projects in a way that works for you and our clients. Deloitte Works is built on trust and allows our people to have flexibility and control in how they work. If you apply for a role, please speak to your recruiter or hiring manager to discuss hybrid working and how it could work for you. Read more about Deloitte Works here.
Deloitte will ensure any reasonable accommodations are implemented as part of the recruitment and selection process.
Deloitte is an equal opportunities employer.
The Opportunity

Technology Consulting | Systems Engineering

Deloitte Technology has an exciting career opportunity for a Junior Java Developer within the Systems Engineering practice. This initial assignment will be based in Dublin working with one of our clients alongside a team of developers from Deloitte.
About the team
Business-led. Technology-enabled.
Business today depends on technology as never before, to drive transformation, productivity and growth. Organisations must innovate to stay ahead of the game, using technology to enable change. Deloitte combines powerful process with technology implementation capability which enables us to take strategic plans and designs, and help our clients turn them into reality. From advisory to technology-enabled transformation programmes, we work with business leaders to solve their toughest challenges through applied innovation - backed by worldwide resources, deep strategic alliances, and full-spectrum delivery across strategy, implementation, management and operations. The result? Technology's promise fulfilled.
You will be responsible for
Coding new developments and / or enhancements as defined in a technical design
Adhere to code quality and unit testing standards
Identify and implement integration tests, automating tests where appropriate.
Participating in peer reviews of code
Providing system test support when code is migrated to System Test
Design and delivery of innovative solutions to client needs using J2EE technology
Learning and using agile developmental techniques
Learning and exploiting cloud computing technologies
Creating the delivery of high quality solutions that are validated using approaches such as Test driven development
Leveraging and utilising Industry design patterns to deliver scalable and extensible solutions
Working with a team to design and deliver innovative solutions using the latest open source and proprietary technologies
Exploiting Industry best practices and your experience to create business solutions for our clients
About you:
Third level qualification in Computer Science/Engineering or a related discipline
Java / J2EE development experience essential
Ideally 2-3+ years demonstrated industry experience in one or more of the following:
Systems Analysis & Design; Software Development
Object Orientated Design; Software Development techniques
Agile
Java Technologies, Hibernate, Spring frameworks, Springboot, Web services, XML, Unit testing (JUnit), Angular, Kubernetes, Kafka, APIs, Docker, containers, Microservices, OpenShift
Java Technologies, Hibernate, Spring, Web services, XML, Maven, JUnit,
Database Development & Administration in - Oracle, SQL Server in particular
Development Experience in Multiple Operating Systems
Implementation of Software Patterns; Web Design and Development
Previous client facing / consulting experience would be an advantage
Highly motivated, with a proven ability to work on own initiative within a challenging and dynamic work environment
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team with professionals at all levels
Excellent communication (both spoken and written), planning, project management, networking and influencing skills
Ability to prioritise tasks and work on multiple assignments
Strong analytical skills and logical approach
Strong commitment to professional and client service excellence
Why join Deloitte:
We offer the opportunity to work with diverse and varied clients across a number of different industry sectors. We provide a challenging and exciting work environment with scope for personal development and on-going training. You will be continually encouraged to devise innovative solutions in order to help deliver our clients’ needs, whilst developing both your technical and business skill set.
Benefits
Training opportunities (access to premium online training platforms, in-house training, internal & external technical training, certification/exam support)
Professional subscription: the firm will cover the cost of annual subscription to one approved professional body
Tech events: attending external and Deloitte Technology's internal Tech seminars with SMEs in the practice as well as external speakers (topics in the past have included Azure, AWS, Big Data, Blockchain, DevOps, MuleSoft, Robotics)
Deloitte Unplugged programme: initiatives which focus on employee wellness and wellbeing
Corporate deals: discounts are available from a variety of organisations
Tax efficient travel pass: save up to 51% on travel costs if you take part in our Taxsaver Commuter Ticket scheme
Cycle to work scheme: Deloitte will facilitate the purchase of a bicycle and/or accessories up to a maximum of €1,000 through the cycle to work scheme. The scheme is tax efficient meaning savings of up to 51% on your purchase
Bonus scheme
Pension scheme options available
Life assurance
Health insurance discounts
Social events
Flu vaccination

The consulting practice is built around integrated core capabilities - people, process, technology and industry expertise - the capabilities needed to help clients to tackle their most complex challenges.  
At Deloitte, we trust our people to make the right choices around how, where and when they work. Our empowered hybrid way of working allows you to be collaborative, learn from colleagues, share your experiences, build the relationships that will fuel your career and work on individual projects in a way that works for you and our clients. Deloitte Works is built on trust and allows our people to have flexibility and control in how they work. If you apply for a role, please speak to your recruiter or hiring manager to discuss hybrid working and how it could work for you. Read more about Deloitte Works here. here  
Deloitte will ensure any reasonable accommodations are implemented as part of the recruitment and selection process.  
Deloitte is an equal opportunities employer.  
About the team 
Business-led. Technology-enabled.
Business today depends on technology as never before, to drive transformation, productivity and growth. Organisations must innovate to stay ahead of the game, using technology to enable change. Deloitte combines powerful process with technology implementation capability which enables us to take strategic plans and designs, and help our clients turn them into reality. From advisory to technology-enabled transformation programmes, we work with business leaders to solve their toughest challenges through applied innovation - backed by worldwide resources, deep strategic alliances, and full-spectrum delivery across strategy, implementation, management and operations. The result? Technology's promise fulfilled.
You will be responsible for
Coding new developments and / or enhancements as defined in a technical design
Adhere to code quality and unit testing standards
Identify and implement integration tests, automating tests where appropriate.
Participating in peer reviews of code
Providing system test support when code is migrated to System Test
Design and delivery of innovative solutions to client needs using J2EE technology
Learning and using agile developmental techniques
Learning and exploiting cloud computing technologies
Creating the delivery of high quality solutions that are validated using approaches such as Test driven development
Leveraging and utilising Industry design patterns to deliver scalable and extensible solutions
Working with a team to design and deliver innovative solutions using the latest open source and proprietary technologies
Exploiting Industry best practices and your experience to create business solutions for our clients
About you:
Third level qualification in Computer Science/Engineering or a related discipline
Java / J2EE development experience essential
Ideally 2-3+ years demonstrated industry experience in one or more of the following:
Systems Analysis & Design; Software Development
Object Orientated Design; Software Development techniques
Agile
Java Technologies, Hibernate, Spring frameworks, Springboot, Web services, XML, Unit testing (JUnit), Angular, Kubernetes, Kafka, APIs, Docker, containers, Microservices, OpenShift
Java Technologies, Hibernate, Spring, Web services, XML, Maven, JUnit,
Database Development & Administration in - Oracle, SQL Server in particular
Development Experience in Multiple Operating Systems
Implementation of Software Patterns; Web Design and Development
Previous client facing / consulting experience would be an advantage
Highly motivated, with a proven ability to work on own initiative within a challenging and dynamic work environment
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team with professionals at all levels
Excellent communication (both spoken and written), planning, project management, networking and influencing skills
Ability to prioritise tasks and work on multiple assignments
Strong analytical skills and logical approach
Strong commitment to professional and client service excellence
Why join Deloitte:
We offer the opportunity to work with diverse and varied clients across a number of different industry sectors. We provide a challenging and exciting work environment with scope for personal development and on-going training. You will be continually encouraged to devise innovative solutions in order to help deliver our clients’ needs, whilst developing both your technical and business skill set.
Benefits
Training opportunities (access to premium online training platforms, in-house training, internal & external technical training, certification/exam support)
Professional subscription: the firm will cover the cost of annual subscription to one approved professional body

Deloitte Unplugged programme: initiatives which focus on employee wellness and wellbeing

C#.NET Software Engineer

Osborne IT Division is currently recruiting for a C#.NET Software Engineer to work at an established company based in Dublin. This role is a fulltime permanent role with hybrid remote working.

As the C# .NET Developer, you will be responsible for the full software development lifecycle in an agile environment. You will work in a team of 3 and 5 software developers, dealing with various internal projects.

To be considered for this position you must be eligible to work in the Republic of Ireland (Visa Stamp 1G, Stamp 2, Stamp 4 and EU nationals)


Salary: €60,000

Job Description:
Full SDLC
Produce and develop a well-designed, clean and testable code.
Integrate software components into a fully functional software system.
Developer QA procedures and verification plans.
Producing detailed specifications and writing the program codes.
Comply with project plans and industry standards.


Job Requirements:
Degree in IT.
Minimum 4 Years' experience in ASP.NET Development Role.
Strong Experience and Knowledge of ASP.NET MVC and C#.
Experience with .NET Frameworks 3.5, 4 or 4.5. and .Net web-service frameworks (WCF, Web API etc.).
Experience of Microsoft Visual Studio 2010 or 2012.
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2008/2012.
Experience of source control applications.
Experience of Unit Testing and Mocking tools, preferably Test Driven Development.
Experience of Agile Development Processes.


For more information please apply through the link provided for the attention of Cáitriona Dennehy, email caitriona.dennehy@osborne.ie . "Please submit your updated Resume in Word Format"

If you are interested in finding out more about the above role and would like to be considered other suitable roles that we may have available for your skill set - please attach your CV via the link provided


If you are living in Ireland and hold a valid work permit we would love to hear from you, if however you do not hold a valid work permit unfortunately we will not be in a position to assist you with your job search.

job_title: Front End Developer (m/f/d) - Automotive Fleet Solutions
listing_jobDesc:
Work at the forefront of automotive innovation with ZF,

one of the world’s leading automotive suppliers.

Front End Developer (m/f/d) - Automotive Fleet Solutions

Location:
Dublin, IE, D02 AE12

Req ID 38349

We are looking for a new colleague for our Software Engineering department at our location in Dublin.

You will work in an office in the city center of Dublin with an open and transparent corporate culture where leadership, relations and respect are important values. Our employees are passionate about their job and are all convinced that team spirit is at the heart of our success.

In this stimulating, fast-growing and challenging environment, we offer you very competitive compensation and benefits, including:

Pension scheme

Health insurance

Your tasks as a Front-End Developer (m/f/d) - Automotive Fleet Solutions:

Working with the Product team to build products from proof of concept to production for ZF's product catalogue

Continuous improvement in developing, maintaining & enhancing responsive client-side web applications

Design and developing robust, high quality sustainable code

Engage with Software Development methodologies such as Scrum/ Kanban to collaborate, deliver and report during the sprint

Your profile as a Front-End Developer (m/f/d) - Automotive Fleet Solutions:

Computer Science degree or equivalent

Multiple years of strong frontend experience, with the modern JavaScript Frameworks (at least 2 years with React.JS) and advanced HTML and CSS experience (2 years professionally)

Experience with ES6 / Typescript and knowledge of all aspects of responsive UI development is preferred

Experienced with consuming web REST APIs, AWS IoT MQTT, Serverless, EC2, Elastic BeanStalk and API Gateway are a nice to have

Must have a passion for technology, eager to learn new emerging web technologies to drive innovation and quality, strong analytical mindset and excellent communication skills (in English)

Be part of our ZF team as Front End Developer (m/f/d) - Automotive Fleet Solutions and apply now!

Contact

Ann-Kathrin Reißner

+49211584222169

Gambling.com Group is looking for talented individuals to join its diverse and growing team in Europe. Through a portfolio of brands, including flagship website Gambling.com as well as Bookmakers.co.uk, Casinosource.co.uk and many more, Gambling.com Group helps online gamblers start their consumer journey with confidence by delivering best-in-class content, including expert analysis, reviews, news, tips, odds comparisons and more.

The Group over its 15-year history has positioned itself as one of Europe's primary performance marketing companies and is one of the leaders in responsible player acquisition across the regulated, global online gambling industry. The Group in 2021 completed a successful initial public offering (IPO) on the Nasdaq Global Market in New York, making it the first online gambling affiliate publicly traded in the United States. The Group also was named Affiliate of the Year at the prestigious EGR Operator Awards, becoming only the second two-time winner of the award.

Europe remains a key market of focus for the Group as it continues its period of exciting growth. The Group has offices in Dublin, its EU HQ, and Malta.

We have an opening for a Full-Stack Developer to work on our data focused websites and products focused on the US Sports gambling market. This person will have the opportunity to be involved in depth and at scale with Serverless technologies in building our systems, with AWS lambda primarily.

Responsibilities

Contribute new features to our PHP(Laravel sites) sites
Maintaining our internal tools(PHP) and the API's that power them
Ensure APIs are providing accurate and reliable data to sites at all times
Ensure uptime and availability around key sporting events
Assist with releases and deployments multiple times per day
Work with EU based team and comfortable with slack, zoom pair programming remotely

Requirements

2-3 years of commercial development experience using PHP
Experience building and maintaining websites, applications and API's using Laravel
Understanding of front-end technologies, such as Vue.js
Comfortable with GitHub and the gitflow model
Can use ORM's to access data but also know how to drop down to SQL statements if needed
Clear ability to work in teams, contribute to technical decisions and deliver exciting new products to the world
Possess a strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive
Able to work independently but know when to ask for help
Document all code and features for maintainability

Perks & Benefits

Comprehensive private Healthcare Insurance
Flexible work environment and home office available
Home office allowance
Gym & Leisure Allowance
All the hardware and software you need to be successful
Regular company events and social outings, activities, Spot Awards and a Monthly Social Club
Access to courses for Personal and Career Development

Europe remains a key market of focus for the Group as it continues its period of exciting growth. The Group has offices in Dublin, its EU HQ, and Malta.

We have an opening for a Full-Stack Developer to work on our data focused websites and products focused on the US Sports gambling market. This person will have the opportunity to be involved in depth and at scale with Serverless technologies in building our systems, with AWS lambda primarily.

Responsibilities

Contribute new features to our PHP(Laravel sites) sites
Maintaining our internal tools(PHP) and the API's that power them
Ensure APIs are providing accurate and reliable data to sites at all times
Ensure uptime and availability around key sporting events
Assist with releases and deployments multiple times per day
Work with EU based team and comfortable with slack, zoom pair programming remotely

Requirements

2-3 years of commercial development experience using PHP
Experience building and maintaining websites, applications and API's using Laravel
Understanding of front-end technologies, such as Vue.js
Comfortable with GitHub and the gitflow model
Can use ORM's to access data but also know how to drop down to SQL statements if needed
Clear ability to work in teams, contribute to technical decisions and deliver exciting new products to the world
Possess a strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive
Able to work independently but know when to ask for help
Document all code and features for maintainability

Perks & Benefits

Comprehensive private Healthcare Insurance
Flexible work environment and home office available
Home office allowance
Gym & Leisure Allowance
All the hardware and software you need to be successful
Regular company events and social outings, activities, Spot Awards and a Monthly Social Club
Access to courses for Personal and Career Development
Company Paid Volunteer Day Gambling.com Group is looking for talented individuals to join its diverse and growing team in Europe. Through a portfolio of brands, including flagship website Gambling.com as well as Bookmakers.co.uk, Casinosource.co.uk and many more, Gambling.com Group helps online gamblers start their consumer journey with confidence by delivering best-in-class content, including expert analysis, reviews, news, tips, odds comparisons and more.

The Group over its 15-year history has positioned itself as one of Europe's primary performance marketing companies and is one of the leaders in responsible player acquisition across the regulated, global online gambling industry. The Group in 2021 completed a successful initial public offering (IPO) on the Nasdaq Global Market in New York, making it the first online gambling affiliate publicly traded in the United States. The Group also was named Affiliate of the Year at the prestigious EGR Operator Awards, becoming only the second two-time winner of the award.

Europe remains a key market of focus for the Group as it continues its period of exciting growth. The Group has offices in Dublin, its EU HQ, and Malta.

Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Lead Software Engineer Web Development
Overview

We are looking for a Lead Software Engineer to work on Priceless.com, which is the consumer and partner hub for Mastercard. It provides access to benefits, offers, and unforgettable experiences exclusively for hundreds of millions of Mastercard cardholders. Our mission is make using a Mastercard something Priceless.

Role

As Lead Software Engineer, you are a key player on the Development team. You will apply your broad knowledge of modern web software and cloud technologies to build leading edge, easy-to-use web interfaces, applications, and services, and help run our global cloud server infrastructure that drive our future product enhancements. We are looking for motivated, hands-on individuals who will proactively seek ways to improve our software architecture and development process, and grow the capabilities of our engineering team.

All About You
BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent, Master’s Degree desirableIdeally have good experience with web programming including: PHP, Python, Javascript, MySQL, HTML, CSS, AJAXStrong leadership skills and high EQStrong people management skills to keep engineering team productive, motivated, and happyCan organize complicated projects and simplify complexityThe ability to work and collaborate well with a diverse group of co-workers and corporate partners, understand customer needs, and develop solutions to meet those needs.Strong software architecture skillsAbility to handle scalability and performance issues in web applications on an advanced global AWS cloud server infrastructureStrong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to function well in a dynamic, agile, fast-moving environmentDesire and ability to do hands on software development and some dev ops server automation - can lead by doingIdeally have experience with PHP Web Application Frameworks (especially Yii Framework), Angular, Backbone, etc.A plus if experience setting up server infrastructure before (bonus if on AWS), Bash scripting, MySQL administration/replicationInterest in secure coding practices and web security
COVID-19 Considerations
We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together. In many locations, which may change over time, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice.
In the US, Mastercard is a government contractor, which may legally require most Mastercard employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard.
Corporate Security Responsibility
All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines. Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Your Job
This Senior Software Engineer role is part of our Enterprise Advertising Team and is responsible for the implementation of technical solutions to help our clients manage ther live jobs posts and obtain real time data reporing.
Indeed Software Engineers (SWE''s) have a mix of technical, business and interpersonal skills to create solutions geared for ensuing our enterprise clients have what they need to attract the best talent on the market to fill their roles.
Our SWE's also work closely with Product Managers and other stakeholders to deliver customised solutions but also determine opportunities to incorporate those solutions into the broader portflio of Indeed's products.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with Product Managers, designers & other engineers to translate customer business needs into workable, technical solutions on the Indeed Hire platform in a timely manner.
Joins and participates in client calls to best understand end to end client needs
Partners with internal stakeholders to influence action on unique client requests.
Regularly communicates project updates, progress, risks, and issues to internal and external stakeholders.
Provides support across multiple concurrent complex projects.
Build applications across a full stack of technologies
Continually improve our technical stack and processes
Maintain existing tools and infrastructure as necessary
Who You Are
You will be responsible for entire projects, from working with a Product Manager and a UX Designer on the problem being solved, possible solutions, the UI design, implementation and analytics. You should possess a mix of technical strength, business strength and good product ideas.
We're looking for someone who:
Understands the end user and can build simple, elegant solutions within a short timeframe
Thinks about why something needs to be built, not just what needs to be built
Loves to learn and develop new skills continuously
Is willing to work in a tech stack deemed most suitable for the project
Is excited to work on testing a variety of product ideas, either currently underway or conceived in the future
Understands costs associated with scope of work and can form solutions that are profitable for the company.
Requirements:
BS in Computer Science (or equivalent)
Experience developing web applications with a modern Javascript framework: React, Angular, Vue (or similar frameworks)
Experience with full stack application development, including services development in Java (or similar OO languages)
Experience with data modeling and backend data stores, such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, or DynamoDB (or similar data stores)
Excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills
Deep understanding of best engineering practices for the full software development life cycle (SDLC), including coding standards, code review, source control, build, test, deploy, and operations
Who we are
We are a high performaing engineerng team driven by data, and innovation and focused on building the most popular job site on the planet. With product teams in Dubin, Aberdeen, Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Hyderabad, Singapore and Vancouver, we are changing the way people get jobs all around the world.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.
Salary Range Transparency
Dublin 87,000 - 127,000 EUR per year
Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement
Indeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritised. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, disability, ethnic background, family status, gender identity or expression, marital status, membership of the Traveller Community, national origin, neuro-diversity, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.
Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at +353 1800 816 548, or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview.
Our Policies and Benefits
View Indeed's Applicant Privacy and Accessibility Policies - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobs
Learn about our global employee perks, programs and benefits - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/

job_title: Front End Engineer - DynamoDB, DynamoDB Consoles Team
listing_jobDesc:
3+ years or more years of experience developing objected-oriented software, with mastery of one or more of the following languages: JavaScript, Java, Python, C#, C++, and Ruby
A passion for implementing world-class user interfaces that make use of the latest and best web technologies
Current understanding of modern web-development technologies and techniques, including HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX, and web services such as RESTful
Experience communicating directly with customers and designing solutions that solve their problems through innovation and automation
Understanding of how to build software in a continuous integration and continuous deployment environment

Job summary
Are you interested in building operational interfaces to support some of the largest distributed systems in the world? 
Do you want to revolutionize the way people view and manage huge volumes of data?
On the Amazon DynamoDB team, our mission is to provide customers with best-in-class cloud data services to store, query, and analyze the enormous datasets that their businesses generate. We build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage and use. These are exciting times—we are building an elite team of developers in Dublin to work on ambitious initiatives to keep pace with the global demand for DynamoDB.
We are currently looking for an expert front-end engineer with a strong user-experience background to build operational user interfaces for our customers. We are looking for smart, motivated engineers who are passionate about delivering a world-class customer experience. If you have the skills for building high-performance, customer-friendly products that delight customers, and you are interested in cutting-edge cloud computing, this might be the job for you.
Successful candidates for this position should have a strong background in building web applications using current technologies such as HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, and web UI frameworks such as jQuery, React, and Flux. Experience working with web services and JSON services is desired.
 Equally important to these specific skills are a candidate's ability to multitask, quickly adapt to new development environments and changing business requirements, learn new systems, create reliable and maintainable code, and find creative and scalable solutions to difficult problems.
AWS is a unique place where you can design and build innovative technologies in a very large distributed-computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.

A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Experience in a 24/7 production environment
Experience with agile engineering practices, including continuous integration and test-driven development
Experience as a full-stack engineer

Boostlingo is a fun, fast-growing language software and technology company focused on defining and developing the next generation of interpretation technology solutions. We are all about creating technology that connects people across the globe and breaking down communication barriers. We deliver multilingual communication access via interpretation delivery and interpretation management software applications.At Boostlingo, our vision is to provide technologies that provide seamless access to language support services. Boostlingo serves clients in a variety of markets with a focus on Health Care, Legal, Education and Financial Services. Boostlingo’s product and its on-demand network of professional interpreters allows customers to provide over-the-phone and video-remote interpretations to their clients.Boostlingo is looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our talented engineering team in Ireland, located at the Kells Enterprise and Technology Center. You will work closely with engineering, QA, DevOps and product teams to help define and improve how we build, test and ship our products. You must be a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, agile environment, and must be able to prioritize, multi-task and manage your workload while providing guidance to other team members.As a senior member of the engineering team you will be expected to lead development projects from requirements review through implementation and testing and to ensure that high quality features and functionality are delivered to production systems.This is an exciting opportunity for a senior engineer to be a core contributor on a cutting edge SaaS platform with web and native mobile components using advanced technologies such as telephony and video communication for real time interactions between users. Your role will be critical in ensuring that the engineering team delivers quality code that meets the needs of end users. You will help define the engineering culture that develops mission critical SaaS software in a secure and iterative fashion meeting the highest quality standards.What you will do:Participate in the product development process of SaaS applicationsDesign and develop scalable, secure and reusable softwareWork independently, meet deadlines, adapt to shifting priorities, and manage multiple projects at a timeLead, collaborate, mentor and manage a small team of developers (onshore/offshore)Be a voice of engineering in reviewing feature requirements and communicating implementation approaches with the product and engineering teamReview code and promote/enforce clean coding principles and design patternsAssist with deployments and work with DevOps to troubleshoot operational issues.Monitor application metrics to ensure the expected results are met with continual user growthContribute to creating an engineering culture that supports innovation and creativity while delivering high quality products with predictability and reliability and one that fosters ownership and teamwork over individualism.*What we are looking for:7+ years of hands-on experience in design, architecture, and development activities using Java/Groovy, MySQL, JavaScript, NodeJS React, Angular, JavaScript, TypeScriptFluent in the Java tech stack (Java, Linux, Apache, MySQL (RDS)) or other high-level language (e.g., C#, .NET, C++), and not afraid to take on other new technologiesExperience with Service Oriented Architecture and MicroservicesExperience in creating and using scalable and distributed RESTful Web APIsExperience in developing modern web sites, dashboards and visualizationsExperienced with tuning application performance, as well as writing unit and integration automated testsExperienced in building CI/CD pipelinesProficient at using appropriate security, testing, documentation, and/or monitoring best practicesExcellent presentation, verbal and written communication skillsAbility to communicate both technical and non-technical aspects in a clear and effective mannerA Startup employee mindsetNice to have:Direct experience with Twilio in one or more of the following areas:Programmable VideoProgrammable VoiceProgrammable IVRPBX systems (e.g., Asterisk)Cloud services - Design, Development, Deployment and MaintainServer-side technologies – Redis, SignalR, Hangfire, Serilog, Microservices, RabbitMQ, MassTransitSecurity technologies - SSO, SAML, OAuth, JWTAWS – EC2/RDS/S3 Design, management, securityJob Type: Full-timePay: €43,141.14-€90,108.59 per yearBenefits:FlexitimeOn-site parkingWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to commute/relocate:Kells, CO.
